<MarginText>97.2/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Has_Element (Position : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>97.3/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p>Returns True if Position designates an element, and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>97.c/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0005-1", "AI05-0212-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<strong>To be honest: </strong>This function might not detect cursors that designate deleted elements; such cursors are invalid (see below) and the result of calling Has_Element with an invalid cursor is unspecified (but not erroneous). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>97.4/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Has_Element (Container : Vector; Position : Cursor){"\n"}   return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>97.5/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Returns True if Position designates an element in Container, and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>97.d/5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>If Position is No_Element, Has_Element returns False. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>98/2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function "=" (Left, Right : Vector) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>99/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p>If Left and Right denote the same vector object, then the function returns True. If Left and Right have different lengths, then the function returns False. Otherwise, it compares each element in Left to the corresponding element in Right using the generic formal equality operator. If any such comparison returns False, the function returns False; otherwise, it returns True. Any exception raised during evaluation of element equality is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>99.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<strong></strong>This wording describes the canonical semantics. However, the order and number of calls on the formal equality function is unspecified for all of the operations that use it in this package, so an implementation can call it as many or as few times as it needs to get the correct answer. Specifically, there is no requirement to call the formal equality additional times once the answer has been determined. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>99.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited{"\n"}   (Container : Vector) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>99.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Returns True if tampering with cursors or tampering with elements is currently prohibited for Container, and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>99.b/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>Prohibiting tampering with elements also needs to prohibit tampering with cursors, as deleting an element is similar to replacing it. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>99.c/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<strong></strong>Various contracts elsewhere in this specification require that this function be implemented with synchronized data. Moreover, it is possible for tampering to be prohibited by multiple operations (sequentially or in parallel). Therefore, tampering needs to be implemented with an atomic or protected counter. The counter is initialized to zero, and is incremented when tampering is prohibited, and decremented when leaving an area that prohibited tampering. Function Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited returns True if the counter is nonzero. (Note that any case where the result is not well-defined for one task is incorrect use of shared variables and would be erroneous by the rules of <a href="../AA-9/AA-9.10">9.10</a>, so no special protection is needed to read the counter.) <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>99.3/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited{"\n"}   (Container : Vector) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>99.4/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Always returns False[, regardless of whether tampering with elements is prohibited].<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>99.d/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>A definite element cannot change size, so we allow operations that tamper with elements even when tampering with elements is prohibited. That's not true for the indefinite containers, which is why this kind of tampering exists. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>99.5/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Maximum_Length return Count_Type{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>99.6/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Returns the maximum Length of a Vector, based on the index type.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>99.e/5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<strong></strong>This is just:<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>99.f</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
  {"\n"}  Count_Type (Index_Type'Last - Index_Type'First + 1){"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>99.g/5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
but since the inner calculation can overflow or the type conversion can fail, this can't be evaluated in general with an expression function. Note that if this expression raises Constraint_Error, then the result is Count_Type'Last, since the Capacity of a Vector cannot exceed Count_Type'Last. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>99.7/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Empty (Capacity : Count_Type := implementation-defined){"\n"}   return Vector{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Capacity {"<"}= Maximum_Length{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} {"\n"}           Capacity (Empty'Result) {">"}= Capacity and then{"\n"}           not Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited (Empty'Result) and then{"\n"}           not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Empty'Result) and then{"\n"}           Length (Empty'Result) = 0;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>99.8/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0339-1"]} />
<p>Returns an empty vector.<br /></p>

<MarginText>100/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function To_Vector (Length : Count_Type) return Vector{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Length {"<"}= Maximum_Length or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"}{"\n"}           To_Vector'Result.Length = Length and then{"\n"}           not Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited (To_Vector'Result){"\n"}             and then{"\n"}           not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (To_Vector'Result){"\n"}             and then{"\n"}           To_Vector'Result.Capacity {">"}= Length;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>101/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Returns a vector with a length of Length, filled with empty elements.<br /></p>

<MarginText>102/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function To_Vector{"\n"}  (New_Item : Element_Type;{"\n"}   Length   : Count_Type) return Vector{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Length {"<"}= Maximum_Length or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"}{"\n"}           To_Vector'Result.Length = Length and then{"\n"}           not Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited (To_Vector'Result){"\n"}             and then{"\n"}           not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (To_Vector'Result){"\n"}             and then{"\n"}        To_Vector'Result.Capacity {">"}= Length;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>103/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Returns a vector with a length of Length, filled with elements initialized to the value New_Item.<br /></p>

<MarginText>104/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function "&" (Left, Right : Vector) return Vector{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Length (Left) {"<"}= Maximum_Length - Length (Right){"\n"}                 or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Vectors."&"'Result) ={"\n"}                   Length (Left) + Length (Right) and then{"\n"}                not Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited (Vectors."&"'Result){"\n"}                   and then{"\n"}                not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Vectors."&"'Result){"\n"}                   and then{"\n"}                Vectors."&"'Result.Capacity {">"}={"\n"}                   Length (Left) + Length (Right);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>105/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Returns a vector comprising the elements of Left followed by the elements of Right.<br /></p>

<MarginText>106/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function "&" (Left  : Vector;{"\n"}              Right : Element_Type) return Vector{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Length (Left) {"<"}= Maximum_Length - 1{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Vectors."&"'Result.Length = Length (Left) + 1 and then{"\n"}                not Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited (Vectors."&"'Result){"\n"}                   and then{"\n"}                not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Vectors."&"'Result){"\n"}                   and then{"\n"}                Vectors."&"'Result.Capacity {">"}= Length (Left) + 1;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>107/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Returns a vector comprising the elements of Left followed by the element Right.<br /></p>

<MarginText>108/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function "&" (Left  : Element_Type;{"\n"}              Right : Vector) return Vector{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Length (Right) {"<"}= Maximum_Length - 1{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Vectors."&"'Result) = Length (Right) + 1 and then{"\n"}                not Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited (Vectors."&"'Result){"\n"}                   and then{"\n"}                not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Vectors."&"'Result){"\n"}                   and then{"\n"}                Vectors."&"'Result.Capacity {">"}= Length (Right) + 1;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>109/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Returns a vector comprising the element Left followed by the elements of Right.<br /></p>

<MarginText>110/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function "&" (Left, Right  : Element_Type) return Vector{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Maximum_Length {">"}= 2 or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length ("&"'Result) = 2 and then{"\n"}                not Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited (Vectors."&"'Result){"\n"}                   and then{"\n"}                not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Vectors."&"'Result){"\n"}                   and then{"\n"}                Vectors."&"'Result.Capacity {">"}= 2;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>111/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Returns a vector comprising the element Left followed by the element Right.<br /></p>

<MarginText>112/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Capacity (Container : Vector) return Count_Type{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>113/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Returns the capacity of Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>114/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Reserve_Capacity (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                            Capacity  : in     Count_Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                 or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Container.Capacity {">"}= Capacity;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>115/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p>If the capacity of Container is already greater than or equal to Capacity, then Reserve_Capacity has no effect. Otherwise, Reserve_Capacity allocates additional storage as necessary to ensure that the length of the resulting vector can become at least the value Capacity without requiring an additional call to Reserve_Capacity, and is large enough to hold the current length of Container. Reserve_Capacity then, as necessary, moves elements into the new storage and deallocates any storage no longer needed. Any exception raised during allocation is propagated and Container is not modified.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>115.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>Expanding the internal array can be done by allocating a new, longer array, copying the elements, and deallocating the original array. This may raise Storage_Error, or cause an exception from a controlled subprogram. We require that a failed Reserve_Capacity does not lose any elements if an exception occurs, but we do not require a specific order of evaluations or copying.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>115.b/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
This routine is used to preallocate the internal array to the specified capacity such that future Inserts do not require memory allocation overhead. Therefore, the implementation should allocate the needed memory to make that true at this point, even though the visible semantics could be preserved by waiting until the memory is needed. This doesn't apply to the indefinite element container, because elements will have to be allocated individually.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>115.c/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The implementation does not have to contract the internal array if the capacity is reduced, as any capacity greater than or equal to the specified capacity is allowed.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>116/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Length (Container : Vector) return Count_Type{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>117/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Returns the number of elements in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>118/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Set_Length (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                      Length    : in     Count_Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length {"<"}= Maximum_Length or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Container.Length = Length and then{"\n"}                Capacity (Container) {">"}= Length;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>119/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p>If Length is larger than the capacity of Container, Set_Length calls Reserve_Capacity (Container, Length), then sets the length of the Container to Length. If Length is greater than the original length of Container, empty elements are added to Container; otherwise, elements are removed from Container.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>119.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>No elements are moved by this operation; any new empty elements are added at the end. This follows from the rules that a cursor continues to designate the same element unless the routine is defined to make the cursor ambiguous or invalid; this operation does not do that. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>120/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Is_Empty (Container : Vector) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Is_Empty'Result = (Length (Container) = 0);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>121/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Returns True if Container is empty .<br /></p>

<MarginText>122/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Clear (Container : in out Vector){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container) = 0;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>123/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Removes all the elements from Container. The capacity of Container does not change.<br /></p>

<MarginText>124/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function To_Cursor (Container : Vector;{"\n"}                    Index     : Extended_Index) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} (if Index in{"\n"}                    First_Index (Container) .. Last_Index (Container){"\n"}                 then Has_Element (Container, To_Cursor'Result){"\n"}                 else To_Cursor'Result = No_Element),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>125/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0196-1"]} />
<p>Returns  a cursor designating the element at position Index in Container; returns No_Element if Index does not designate an element . For the purposes of determining whether the parameters overlap in a call to To_Cursor, the Container parameter is not considered to overlap with any object [(including itself)].<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>125.a/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0196-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>Without the preceding rule, concurrent calls to To_Cursor on the same container would interfere by the concurrent call rules in <a href="../AA-A/">Annex A</a>, since the container object of the concurrent calls would overlap with itself. We want these to not interfere, for example to allow the Vector elements to be split into separate &ldquo;chunks&rdquo; for parallel processing. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>126/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function To_Index (Position  : Cursor) return Extended_Index{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>127/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If Position is No_Element, No_Index is returned. Otherwise, the index (within its containing vector) of the element designated by Position is returned.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>127.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>This implies that the index is determinable from a bare cursor alone. The basic model is that a vector cursor is implemented as a record containing an access to the vector container and an index value. This does constrain implementations, but it also allows all of the cursor operations to be defined in terms of the corresponding index operation (which should be primary for a vector). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>127.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function To_Index (Container : Vector;{"\n"}                   Position  : Cursor) return Extended_Index{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Position = No_Element or else{"\n"}                Has_Element (Container, Position)  or else{"\n"}                   raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position = No_Element then To_Index'Result = No_Index{"\n"}                 else To_Index'Result in First_Index (Container) ..{"\n"}                        Last_Index (Container)),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>127.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Returns the index (within Container) of the element designated by Position; returns No_Index if Position does not designate an element. For the purposes of determining whether the parameters overlap in a call to To_Index, the Container parameter is not considered to overlap with any object [(including itself)].<br /></p>

<MarginText>128/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Element (Container : Vector;{"\n"}                  Index     : Index_Type){"\n"}   return Element_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Index in First_Index (Container) .. Last_Index (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} Element_Type;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>129/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Element returns the element at position Index.<br /></p>

<MarginText>130/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Element (Position  : Cursor) return Element_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Position /= No_Element or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} Element_Type;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>131/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Element returns the element designated by Position.<br /></p>

<MarginText>131.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Element (Container : Vector;{"\n"}                  Position  : Cursor) return Element_Type{"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} (Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} Element_Type;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>131.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Element returns the element designated by Position in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>132/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Replace_Element (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                           Index     : in     Index_Type;{"\n"}                           New_Item  : in     Element_Type){"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Index in First_Index (Container) .. Last_Index (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>133/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0196-1"]} />
<p> Replace_Element assigns the value New_Item to the element at position Index. Any exception raised during the assignment is propagated. The element at position Index is not an empty element after successful call to Replace_Element. For the purposes of determining whether the parameters overlap in a call to Replace_Element, the Container parameter is not considered to overlap with any object [(including itself)], and the Index parameter is considered to overlap with the element at position Index.<br /></p>

<MarginText>134/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Replace_Element (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                           Position  : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                           New_Item  : in     Element_Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>135/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0196-1"]} />
<p> Replace_Element assigns New_Item to the element designated by Position. Any exception raised during the assignment is propagated. The element at Position is not an empty element after successful call to Replace_Element. For the purposes of determining whether the parameters overlap in a call to Replace_Element, the Container parameter is not considered to overlap with any object [(including itself)].<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>135.a/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>Replace_Element, Update_Element, and Reference are the only ways that an element can change from empty to nonempty. Also see the note following Update_Element. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>136/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Query_Element{"\n"}  (Container : in Vector;{"\n"}   Index     : in Index_Type;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Element : in Element_Type)){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Index in First_Index (Container) .. Last_Index (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>137/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Query_Element calls Process.<strong>all</strong> with the element at position Index as the argument. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited during the execution of the call on Process.<strong>all</strong>. Any exception raised by Process.<strong>all</strong> is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>137.a/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0005-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>The &ldquo;tamper with the elements&rdquo; check is intended to prevent the Element parameter of Process from being replaced or deleted outside of Process. The check prevents data loss (if Element_Type is passed by copy) or erroneous execution (if Element_Type is an unconstrained type in an indefinite container). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>138/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Query_Element{"\n"}  (Position : in Cursor;{"\n"}   Process  : not null access procedure (Element : in Element_Type)){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Position /= No_Element or else raise Constraint_Error{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>139/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0021-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Query_Element calls Process.<strong>all</strong> with the element designated by Position as the argument. Tampering with the elements of the vector that contains the element designated by Position is prohibited during the execution of the call on Process.<strong>all</strong>. Any exception raised by Process.<strong>all</strong> is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>139.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Query_Element{"\n"}  (Container : in Vector;{"\n"}   Position  : in Cursor;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Element : in Element_Type)){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>139.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Query_Element calls Process.<strong>all</strong> with the element designated by Position as the argument. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited during the execution of the call on Process.<strong>all</strong>. Any exception raised by Process.<strong>all</strong> is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>140/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Update_Element{"\n"}  (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}   Index     : in     Index_Type;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure{"\n"}                   (Element : in out Element_Type)){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Index in First_Index (Container) .. Last_Index (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>141/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Update_Element calls Process.<strong>all</strong> with the element at position Index as the argument. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited during the execution of the call on Process.<strong>all</strong>. Any exception raised by Process.<strong>all</strong> is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>142/2</MarginText>
<p>If Element_Type is unconstrained and definite, then the actual Element parameter of Process.<strong>all</strong> shall be unconstrained.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>142.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>This means that the elements cannot be directly allocated from the heap; it must be possible to change the discriminants of the element in place. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>143/2</MarginText>
<p>The element at position Index is not an empty element after successful completion of this operation.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>143.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>Since reading an empty element is a bounded error, attempting to use this procedure to replace empty elements may fail. Use Replace_Element to do that reliably. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>144/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Update_Element{"\n"}  (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}   Position  : in     Cursor;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure{"\n"}                   (Element : in out Element_Type)){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>145/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Update_Element calls Process.<strong>all</strong> with the element designated by Position as the argument. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited during the execution of the call on Process.<strong>all</strong>. Any exception raised by Process.<strong>all</strong> is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>146/2</MarginText>
<p>If Element_Type is unconstrained and definite, then the actual Element parameter of Process.<strong>all</strong> shall be unconstrained.<br /></p>

<MarginText>147/2</MarginText>
<p>The element designated by Position is not an empty element after successful completion of this operation.<br /></p>

<MarginText>147.1/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
type Constant_Reference_Type{"\n"}      (Element : not null access constant Element_Type) is private{"\n"}   with Implicit_Dereference ={">"} Element,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in out synchronized,{"\n"}        Default_Initial_Condition ={">"} (raise Program_Error);{"\n"}
<MarginText>147.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
type Reference_Type (Element : not null access Element_Type) is private{"\n"}   with Implicit_Dereference ={">"} Element,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in out synchronized,{"\n"}        Default_Initial_Condition ={">"} (raise Program_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>147.3/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p>The types Constant_Reference_Type and Reference_Type need finalization.<br /></p>

<MarginText>147.4/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p><em>This paragraph was deleted.</em> <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>147.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>It is expected that Reference_Type (and Constant_Reference_Type) will be a controlled type, for which finalization will have some action to terminate the tampering check for the associated container. If the object is created by default, however, there is no associated container. Since this is useless, and supporting this case would take extra work, we define it to raise an exception. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>147.5/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Constant_Reference (Container : aliased in Vector;{"\n"}                             Index     : in Index_Type){"\n"}   return Constant_Reference_Type{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} Index in First_Index (Container) .. Last_Index (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Post   ={">"} Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>147.6/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>This function (combined with the Constant_Indexing and Implicit_Dereference aspects) provides a convenient way to gain read access to an individual element of a vector given an index value.<br /></p>

<MarginText>147.7/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Constant_Reference returns an object whose discriminant is an access value that designates the element at position Index. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited while the object returned by Constant_Reference exists and has not been finalized.<br /></p>

<MarginText>147.8/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Reference (Container : aliased in out Vector;{"\n"}                    Index     : in Index_Type){"\n"}   return Reference_Type{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} Index in First_Index (Container) .. Last_Index (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Post   ={">"} Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>147.9/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>This function (combined with the Variable_Indexing and Implicit_Dereference aspects) provides a convenient way to gain read and write access to an individual element of a vector given an index value.<br /></p>

<MarginText>147.10/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Reference returns an object whose discriminant is an access value that designates the element at position Index. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited while the object returned by Reference exists and has not been finalized.<br /></p>

<MarginText>147.11/3</MarginText>
<p>The element at position Index is not an empty element after successful completion of this operation.<br /></p>

<MarginText>147.12/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Constant_Reference (Container : aliased in Vector;{"\n"}                             Position  : in Cursor){"\n"}   return Constant_Reference_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post   ={">"} Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>

<p> Constant_Reference returns an object whose discriminant is an access value that designates the element designated by Position. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited while the object returned by Constant_Reference exists and has not been finalized.<br /></p>

function Reference (Container : aliased in out Vector;{"\n"}                    Position  : in Cursor){"\n"}   return Reference_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post   ={">"} Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>147.16/3</MarginText>

<p>This function (combined with the Variable_Indexing and Implicit_Dereference aspects) provides a convenient way to gain read and write access to an individual element of a vector given a cursor.<br /></p>

<MarginText>147.17/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Reference returns an object whose discriminant is an access value that designates the element designated by Position. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited while the object returned by Reference exists and has not been finalized.<br /></p>

<MarginText>147.18/3</MarginText>
<p>The element designated by Position is not an empty element after successful completion of this operation.<br /></p>

<MarginText>147.19/3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Assign (Target : in out Vector; Source : in Vector){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Source) = Length (Target) and then{"\n"}                Capacity (Target) {">"}= Length (Target);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>147.20/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>If Target denotes the same object as Source, the operation has no effect. If the length of Source is greater than the capacity of Target, Reserve_Capacity (Target, Length (Source)) is called. The elements of Source are then copied to Target as for an <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code> assigning Source to Target (this includes setting the length of Target to be that of Source). <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>147.b/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0005-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>This routine exists for compatibility with the bounded vector container. For an unbounded vector, Assign(A, B) and A := B behave identically. For a bounded vector, := will raise an exception if the container capacities are different, while Assign will not raise an exception if there is enough room in the target. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>147.21/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Copy (Source : Vector; Capacity : Count_Type := 0){"\n"}   return Vector{"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} Capacity = 0 or else Capacity {">"}= Length (Source){"\n"}                   or else raise Capacity_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Copy'Result) = Length (Source) and then{"\n"}                not Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited (Copy'Result){"\n"}                   and then{"\n"}                not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Copy'Result){"\n"}                   and then{"\n"}                Copy'Result.Capacity {">"}= (if Capacity = 0 then{"\n"}                   Length (Source) else Capacity);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>147.22/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Returns a vector whose elements are initialized from the corresponding elements of Source. <br /></p>

<MarginText>148/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Move (Target : in out Vector;{"\n"}                Source : in out Vector){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Source){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if not Target'Has_Same_Storage (Source) then{"\n"}                    Length (Target) = Length (Source)'Old and then{"\n"}                    Length (Source) = 0 and then{"\n"}                    Capacity (Target) {">"}= Length (Source)'Old);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>149/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>If Target denotes the same object as Source, then the operation has no effect. Otherwise, Move first calls Reserve_Capacity (Target, Length (Source)) and then Clear (Target); then, each element from Source is removed from Source and inserted into Target in the original order. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>149.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<strong></strong>The idea is that the internal array is removed from Source and moved to Target. (See the  for Move). If Capacity (Target) /= 0, the previous internal array may need to be deallocated. We don't mention this explicitly, because it is covered by the "no memory loss" Implementation Requirement. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>150/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert_Vector  (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                         Before    : in     Extended_Index;{"\n"}                         New_Item  : in     Vector){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before in{"\n"}                   First_Index (Container) .. Last_Index (Container) + 1{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Maximum_Length - Length (New_Item){"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old + Length (New_Item) ={"\n"}                   Length (Container) and then{"\n"}                Capacity (Container) {">"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>151/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0400-1"]} />
<p> If Length(New_Item) is 0, then Insert_Vector  does nothing. Otherwise, it computes the new length <em>NL</em> as the sum of the current length and Length (New_Item); if the value of Last appropriate for length <em>NL</em> would be greater than Index_Type'Last, then Constraint_Error is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>152/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0400-1"]} />
<p>If the current vector capacity is less than <em>NL</em>, Reserve_Capacity (Container, <em>NL</em>) is called to increase the vector capacity. Then Insert_Vector  slides the elements in the range Before .. Last_Index (Container) up by Length(New_Item) positions, and then copies the elements of New_Item to the positions starting at Before. Any exception raised during the copying is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>152.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>Moving the elements does not necessarily involve copying. Similarly, since Reserve_Capacity does not require the copying of elements, it does not need to be explicitly called (the implementation can combine the operations if it wishes to). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>153/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert_Vector  (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                         Before    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                         New_Item  : in     Vector){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No_Element or else{"\n"}                 Has_Element (Container, Before){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Maximum_Length - Length (New_Item){"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old + Length (New_Item) ={"\n"}                   Length (Container) and then{"\n"}                Capacity (Container) {">"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>154/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0400-1"]} />
<p>If  Length(New_Item) is 0, then Insert_Vector  does nothing. If Before is No_Element, then the call is equivalent to Insert_Vector  (Container, Last_Index (Container) + 1, New_Item); otherwise, the call is equivalent to Insert_Vector  (Container, To_Index (Before), New_Item);<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>154.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>The check on Before checks that the cursor does not belong to some other Container. This check implies that a reference to the container is included in the cursor value. This wording is not meant to require detection of dangling cursors; such cursors are defined to be invalid, which means that execution is erroneous, and any result is allowed (including not raising an exception). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>155/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert_Vector  (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                         Before    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                         New_Item  : in     Vector;{"\n"}                         Position  :    out Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No_Element or else{"\n"}                 Has_Element (Container, Before){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Maximum_Length - Length (New_Item){"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old + Length (New_Item) ={"\n"}                   Length (Container) and then{"\n"}                Has_Element (Container, Position) and then{"\n"}                Capacity (Container) {">"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>156/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0400-1"]} />
<p> If Before equals No_Element, then let <em>T</em> be Last_Index (Container) + 1; otherwise, let <em>T</em> be To_Index (Before). Insert_Vector  (Container, <em>T</em>, New_Item) is called, and then Position is set to To_Cursor (Container, <em>T</em>).<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>156.a/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0400-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>The messy wording is needed because Before is invalidated by Insert_Vector , and we don't want Position to be invalid after this call. An implementation probably only needs to copy Before to Position. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>157/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                  Before    : in     Extended_Index;{"\n"}                  New_Item  : in     Element_Type;{"\n"}                  Count     : in     Count_Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before in{"\n"}                   First_Index (Container) .. Last_Index (Container) + 1{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Maximum_Length - Count{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old + Count = Length (Container) and then{"\n"}                Capacity (Container) {">"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>158/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Insert (Container, Before, To_Vector (New_Item, Count));<br /></p>

<MarginText>159/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                  Before    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                  New_Item  : in     Element_Type;{"\n"}                  Count     : in     Count_Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No_Element or else{"\n"}                 Has_Element (Container, Before){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Maximum_Length - Count{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old + Count = Length (Container) and then{"\n"}                Capacity (Container) {">"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>160/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Insert (Container, Before, To_Vector (New_Item, Count));<br /></p>

<MarginText>161/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                  Before    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                  New_Item  : in     Element_Type;{"\n"}                  Position  :    out Cursor;{"\n"}                  Count     : in     Count_Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No_Element or else{"\n"}                 Has_Element (Container, Before){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Maximum_Length - Count{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old + Count = Length (Container) and then{"\n"}                Has_Element (Container, Position) and then{"\n"}                Capacity (Container) {">"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>162/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Insert (Container, Before, To_Vector (New_Item, Count), Position);<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>162.a/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0257-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>If Count equals 0, Position will designate the element designated by Before, rather than a newly inserted element. Otherwise, Position will designate the first newly inserted element. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>163/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                  Before    : in     Extended_Index;{"\n"}                  Count     : in     Count_Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before in{"\n"}                   First_Index (Container) .. Last_Index (Container) + 1{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Maximum_Length - Count{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old + Count = Length (Container) and then{"\n"}                Capacity (Container) {">"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>164/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> If Count is 0, then Insert does nothing. Otherwise, it computes the new length <em>NL</em> as the sum of the current length and Count; if the value of Last appropriate for length <em>NL</em> would be greater than Index_Type'Last, then Constraint_Error is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>165/2</MarginText>
<p>If the current vector capacity is less than <em>NL</em>, Reserve_Capacity (Container, <em>NL</em>) is called to increase the vector capacity. Then Insert slides the elements in the range Before .. Last_Index (Container) up by Count positions, and then inserts elements that are initialized by default (see <a href="../AA-3/AA-3.3#Subclause_3.3.1">3.3.1</a>) in the positions starting at Before.<br /></p>

<MarginText>166/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                  Before    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                  Position  :    out Cursor;{"\n"}                  Count     : in     Count_Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No_Element or else{"\n"}                 Has_Element (Container, Before){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Maximum_Length - Count{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old + Count = Length (Container) and then{"\n"}                Has_Element (Container, Position) and then{"\n"}                Capacity (Container) {">"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>167/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> If Before equals No_Element, then let <em>T</em> be Last_Index (Container) + 1; otherwise, let <em>T</em> be To_Index (Before). Insert (Container, <em>T</em>, Count) is called, and then Position is set to To_Cursor (Container, <em>T</em>).<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>167.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>This routine exists mainly to ease conversion between Vector and List containers. Unlike Insert_Space, this routine default initializes the elements it inserts, which can be more expensive for some element types. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>168/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0080-1", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0400-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Prepend_Vector  (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                          New_Item  : in     Vector){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Maximum_Length - Length (New_Item){"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old + Length (New_Item) ={"\n"}                   Length (Container) and then{"\n"}                Capacity (Container) {">"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>169/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Insert (Container, First_Index (Container), New_Item).<br /></p>

<MarginText>170/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Prepend (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                   New_Item  : in     Element_Type;{"\n"}                   Count     : in     Count_Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Maximum_Length - Count{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old + Count = Length (Container) and then{"\n"}                Capacity (Container) {">"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>171/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Insert (Container, First_Index (Container), New_Item, Count).<br /></p>

<MarginText>172/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0400-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Append_Vector  (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                         New_Item  : in     Vector){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Maximum_Length - Length (New_Item){"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old + Length (New_Item) ={"\n"}                   Length (Container) and then{"\n"}                Capacity (Container) {">"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>173/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Insert (Container, Last_Index (Container) + 1, New_Item).<br /></p>

<MarginText>174/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0400-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Append (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                  New_Item  : in     Element_Type;{"\n"}                  Count     : in     Count_Type ){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Maximum_Length - Count{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old + Count = Length (Container) and then{"\n"}                Capacity (Container) {">"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>175/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Insert (Container, Last_Index (Container) + 1, New_Item, Count).<br /></p>

<MarginText>175.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Append (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                  New_Item  : in     Element_Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Maximum_Length - 1{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old + 1 = Length (Container) and then{"\n"}                Capacity (Container) {">"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>175.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0212-1", "AI12-0400-1"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Insert (Container, Last_Index (Container) + 1, New_Item, 1).<br /></p>

<MarginText>176/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert_Space (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                        Before    : in     Extended_Index;{"\n"}                        Count     : in     Count_Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before in{"\n"}                   First_Index (Container) .. Last_Index (Container) + 1{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Maximum_Length - Count{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old + Count = Length (Container) and then{"\n"}                Capacity (Container) {">"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>177/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> If Count is 0, then Insert_Space does nothing. Otherwise, it computes the new length <em>NL</em> as the sum of the current length and Count; if the value of Last appropriate for length <em>NL</em> would be greater than Index_Type'Last, then Constraint_Error is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>178/2</MarginText>
<p>If the current vector capacity is less than <em>NL</em>, Reserve_Capacity (Container, <em>NL</em>) is called to increase the vector capacity. Then Insert_Space slides the elements in the range Before .. Last_Index (Container) up by Count positions, and then inserts empty elements in the positions starting at Before.<br /></p>

<MarginText>179/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert_Space (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                        Before    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                        Position  :    out Cursor;{"\n"}                        Count     : in     Count_Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No_Element or else{"\n"}                   Has_Element (Container, Before){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Maximum_Length - Count{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old + Count = Length (Container) and then{"\n"}                Has_Element (Container, Position) and then{"\n"}                Capacity (Container) {">"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>180/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> If Before equals No_Element, then let <em>T</em> be Last_Index (Container) + 1; otherwise, let <em>T</em> be To_Index (Before). Insert_Space (Container, <em>T</em>, Count) is called, and then Position is set to To_Cursor (Container, <em>T</em>).<br /></p>

<MarginText>181/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Delete (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                  Index     : in     Extended_Index;{"\n"}                  Count     : in     Count_Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Index in{"\n"}                   First_Index (Container) .. Last_Index (Container) + 1{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old - Count {"<"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>182/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> If Count is 0, Delete has no effect. Otherwise, Delete slides the elements (if any) starting at position Index + Count down to Index. Any exception raised during element assignment is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>182.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>If Index + Count {">"}= Last_Index(Container), this effectively truncates the vector (setting Last_Index to Index &ndash; 1 and consequently sets Length to Index &ndash; Index_Type'First). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>183/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Delete (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                  Position  : in out Cursor;{"\n"}                  Count     : in     Count_Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old - Count {"<"}= Length (Container){"\n"}                and then Position = No_Element;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>184/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Delete (Container, To_Index (Position), Count) is called, and then Position is set to No_Element.<br /></p>

<MarginText>185/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Delete_First (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                        Count     : in     Count_Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old - Count {"<"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>186/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Delete (Container, First_Index (Container), Count).<br /></p>

<MarginText>187/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Delete_Last (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                       Count     : in     Count_Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old - Count {"<"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>188/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p>If Length (Container) {"<"}= Count, then Delete_Last is equivalent to Clear (Container). Otherwise, it is equivalent to Delete (Container, Index_Type'Val(Index_Type'Pos(Last_Index (Container)) &ndash; Count + 1), Count).<br /></p>

<MarginText>189/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0092-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Reverse_Elements (Container : in out Vector){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>190/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Reorders the elements of Container in reverse order.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>190.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>This can copy the elements of the vector &mdash; all cursors referencing the vector are ambiguous afterwards and may designate different elements afterwards. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>191/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Swap (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                I, J      : in     Index_Type){"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                  or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}               (I in First_Index (Container) .. Last_Index (Container){"\n"}                  or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}               (J in First_Index (Container) .. Last_Index (Container){"\n"}                  or else raise Constraint_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>192/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Swap exchanges the values of the elements at positions I and J.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>192.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<strong>To be honest: </strong>The implementation is not required to actually copy the elements if it can do the swap some other way. But it is allowed to copy the elements if needed. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>193/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Swap (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                I, J      : in     Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (I /= No_Element or else Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (J /= No_Element or else Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, I){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, J){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>194/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Swap exchanges the values of the elements designated by I and J.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>194.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>After a call to Swap, I designates the element value previously designated by J, and J designates the element value previously designated by I. The cursors do not become ambiguous from this operation. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>194.b/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<strong>To be honest: </strong>The implementation is not required to actually copy the elements if it can do the swap some other way. But it is allowed to copy the elements if needed. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>195/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function First_Index (Container : Vector) return Index_Type{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} First_Index'Result = Index_Type'First;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>196/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Returns the value Index_Type'First.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>196.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>We'd rather call this &ldquo;First&rdquo;, but then calling most routines in here with First (Some_Vect) would be ambiguous. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>197/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function First (Container : Vector) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if not Is_Empty (Container){"\n"}                 then Has_Element (Container, First'Result){"\n"}                 else First'Result = No_Element);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>198/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If Container is empty, First returns No_Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor that designates the first element in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>199/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function First_Element (Container : Vector){"\n"}   return Element_Type{"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} (not Is_Empty (Container) {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>200/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Element (Container, First_Index (Container)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>201/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Last_Index (Container : Vector) return Extended_Index{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Length (Container) = 0 then Last_Index'Result = No_Index{"\n"}                 else Count_Type(Last_Index'Result - Index_Type'First) ={"\n"}                      Length (Container) - 1);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>202/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If Container is empty, Last_Index returns No_Index. Otherwise, it returns the position of the last element in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>203/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Last (Container : Vector) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if not Is_Empty (Container){"\n"}                 then Has_Element (Container, Last'Result){"\n"}                 else Last'Result = No_Element);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>204/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If Container is empty, Last returns No_Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor that designates the last element in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>205/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Last_Element (Container : Vector){"\n"}   return Element_Type{"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} (not Is_Empty (Container) {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>206/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Element (Container, Last_Index (Container)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>207/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Next (Position : Cursor) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position = No_Element then Next'Result = No_Element);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>208/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If Position equals No_Element or designates the last element of the container, then Next returns the value No_Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor that designates the element with index To_Index (Position) + 1 in the same vector as Position.<br /></p>

<MarginText>208.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Next (Container : Vector;{"\n"}               Position : Cursor) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position = No_Element or else{"\n"}                Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position = No_Element then Next'Result = No_Element{"\n"}                 elsif Has_Element (Container, Next'Result) then{"\n"}                    To_Index (Container, Next'Result) ={"\n"}                    To_Index (Container, Position) + 1{"\n"}                 elsif Next'Result = No_Element then{"\n"}                    Position = Last (Container){"\n"}                 else False);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>208.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Returns a cursor designating the next element in Container, if any.<br /></p>

<MarginText>209/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Next (Position : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>210/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Position := Next (Position).<br /></p>

<MarginText>210.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Next (Container : in     Vector;{"\n"}                Position  : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position = No_Element or else{"\n"}                Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                 then Has_Element (Container, Position));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>210.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Position := Next (Container, Position).<br /></p>

<MarginText>211/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Previous (Position : Cursor) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position = No_Element {"\n"}                 then Previous'Result = No_Element);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>212/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If Position equals No_Element or designates the first element of the container, then Previous returns the value No_Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor that designates the element with index To_Index (Position) &ndash; 1 in the same vector as Position.<br /></p>

<MarginText>212.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Previous (Container : Vector;{"\n"}                   Position  : Cursor) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position = No_Element or else{"\n"}                Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position = No_Element then Previous'Result = No_Element{"\n"}                 elsif Has_Element (Container, Previous'Result) then{"\n"}                   To_Index (Container, Previous'Result) ={"\n"}                   To_Index (Container, Position) - 1{"\n"}                 elsif Previous'Result = No_Element then{"\n"}                   Position = First (Container){"\n"}                 else False);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>212.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Returns a cursor designating the previous element in Container, if any.<br /></p>

<MarginText>213/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Previous (Position : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>214/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Position := Previous (Position).<br /></p>

<MarginText>214.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Previous (Container : in     Vector;{"\n"}                    Position  : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position = No_Element or else{"\n"}                Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                 then Has_Element (Container, Position));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>214.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Position := Previous (Container, Position).<br /></p>

<MarginText>215/2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Find_Index (Container : Vector;{"\n"}                     Item      : Element_Type;{"\n"}                     Index     : Index_Type := Index_Type'First){"\n"}   return Extended_Index;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>216/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Searches the elements of Container for an element equal to Item (using the generic formal equality operator). The search starts at position Index and proceeds towards Last_Index (Container). If no equal element is found, then Find_Index returns No_Index. Otherwise, it returns the index of the first equal element encountered.<br /></p>

<MarginText>217/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Find (Container : Vector;{"\n"}               Item      : Element_Type;{"\n"}               Position  : Cursor := No_Element){"\n"}   return Cursor{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Position = No_Element or else{"\n"}                Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Find'Result /= No_Element{"\n"}                 then Has_Element (Container, Find'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>218/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Find searches the elements of Container for an element equal to Item (using the generic formal equality operator). The search starts at the first element if Position equals No_Element, and at the element designated by Position otherwise. It proceeds towards the last element of Container. If no equal element is found, then Find returns No_Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor designating the first equal element encountered.<br /></p>

<MarginText>219/2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Reverse_Find_Index (Container : Vector;{"\n"}                             Item      : Element_Type;{"\n"}                             Index     : Index_Type := Index_Type'Last){"\n"}   return Extended_Index;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>220/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Searches the elements of Container for an element equal to Item (using the generic formal equality operator). The search starts at position Index or, if Index is greater than Last_Index (Container), at position Last_Index (Container). It proceeds towards First_Index (Container). If no equal element is found, then Reverse_Find_Index returns No_Index. Otherwise, it returns the index of the first equal element encountered.<br /></p>

<MarginText>221/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
