<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>164.s/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Added contracts to this container. This includes describing some of the semantics with pre- and postconditions, rather than English text. Note that the preconditions can be Suppressed (see <a href="../AA-11/AA-11.5">11.5</a>).<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>164.t/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0400-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<strong></strong> Split the Append routine into two routines rather than having a single routine with a default parameter, in order that a routine with the appropriate profile for the Aggregate aspect exists. This change should not change the behavior of any existing code. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<a id="Subclause_A.18.4"></a>

## A.18.4  Maps

<MarginText>1/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The language-defined generic packages Containers.Hashed_Maps and Containers.Ordered_Maps provide private types Map and Cursor, and a set of operations for each type. A map container allows an arbitrary type to be used as a key to find the element associated with that key. A hashed map uses a hash function to organize the keys, while an ordered map orders the keys per a specified relation. <br /></p>

<MarginText>2/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0299-1"]} />
<p>This subclause describes the declarations that are common to both kinds of maps. See <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.5">A.18.5</a> for a description of the semantics specific to Containers.Hashed_Maps and <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.6">A.18.6</a> for a description of the semantics specific to Containers.Ordered_Maps. <br /></p>


#### Static Semantics

<MarginText>3/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The actual function for the generic formal function "=" on Element_Type values is expected to define a reflexive and symmetric relationship and return the same result value each time it is called with a particular pair of values. If it behaves in some other manner, the function "=" on map values returns an unspecified value. The exact arguments and number of calls of this generic formal function by the function "=" on map values are unspecified.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>3.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>If the actual function for "=" is not symmetric and consistent, the result returned by "=" for Map objects cannot be predicted. The implementation is not required to protect against "=" raising an exception, or returning random results, or any other &ldquo;bad&rdquo; behavior. And it can call "=" in whatever manner makes sense. But note that only the result of "=" for Map objects is unspecified; other subprograms are not allowed to break if "=" is bad (they aren't expected to use "="). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>4/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The type Map is used to represent maps. The type Map needs finalization (see <a href="../AA-7/AA-7.6">7.6</a>).<br /></p>

<MarginText>5/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>A map contains pairs of keys and elements, called <em>nodes</em>. Map cursors designate nodes, but also can be thought of as designating an element (the element contained in the node) for consistency with the other containers. There exists an equivalence relation on keys, whose definition is different for hashed maps and ordered maps. A map never contains two or more nodes with equivalent keys. The <em>length</em> of a map is the number of nodes it contains.<br /></p>

<MarginText>6/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Each nonempty map has two particular nodes called the <em>first node</em> and the <em>last node</em> (which may be the same). Each node except for the last node has a <em>successor node</em>. If there are no other intervening operations, starting with the first node and repeatedly going to the successor node will visit each node in the map exactly once until the last node is reached. The exact definition of these terms is different for hashed maps and ordered maps.<br /></p>

<MarginText>7/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>[Some operations  check for &ldquo;tampering with cursors&rdquo; of a container because they depend on the set of elements of the container remaining constant, and others check for &ldquo;tampering with elements&rdquo; of a container because they depend on elements of the container not being replaced.] When tampering with cursors is <em>prohibited</em> for a particular map object <em>M</em>, Program_Error is propagated by the finalization of <em>M</em>[, as well as by a call that passes <em>M</em> to certain of the operations of this package, as indicated by the precondition of such an operation]. Similarly, when tampering with elements is <em>prohibited</em> for <em>M</em>, Program_Error is propagated by a call that passes <em>M</em> to certain of the other operations of this package, as indicated by the precondition of such an operation.<br /></p>

<p><em>Paragraphs 8 through 15 are removed as preconditions now describe these rules.</em> <br /></p>

<MarginText>8/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> <br /></p>

<MarginText>9/5</MarginText>
<ul>
<li> <br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>9.a/5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<strong>To be honest: </strong> <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>10/5</MarginText>
<ul>
<li> <br /></li>
<MarginText>10.1/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<li> <br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>10.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>We don't need to explicitly mention <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code>, because that finalizes the target object as part of the operation, and finalization of an object is already defined as tampering with cursors. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>11/5</MarginText>
<ul>
<li> <br /></li>
<MarginText>12/5</MarginText>
<li> <br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>12.a/5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong> <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>13/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> <br /></p>

<MarginText>14/5</MarginText>
<ul>
<li> <br /></li>
<MarginText>15/5</MarginText>
<li> <br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>15.a/5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong> <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>15.1/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0110-1", "AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>15.b/5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="proof">
<strong></strong> <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>16/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Empty_Map represents the empty Map object. It has a length of 0. If an object of type Map is not otherwise initialized, it is initialized to the same value as Empty_Map.<br /></p>

<MarginText>17/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>No_Element represents a cursor that designates no node. If an object of type Cursor is not otherwise initialized, it is initialized to the same value as No_Element.<br /></p>

<MarginText>18/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0434-1"]} />
<p>The primitive  "=" operator for type Cursor returns True if both cursors are No_Element, or designate the same element in the same container.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>18.a/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0434-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<strong>To be honest: </strong>&ldquo;The primitive "=" operator&rdquo; is the one with two parameters of type Cursor which returns Boolean. We're not talking about some other (hidden) primitive function named "=". <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>19/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Execution of the default implementation of the Input, Output, Read, or Write attribute of type Cursor raises Program_Error.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>19.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>A cursor will probably be implemented in terms of one or more access values, and the effects of streaming access values is unspecified. Rather than letting the user stream junk by accident, we mandate that streaming of cursors raise Program_Error by default. The attributes can always be specified if there is a need to support streaming. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>19.1/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI12-0437-1"]} />
<p>Map'Write for a Map object <em>M</em> writes Length(<em>M</em>) elements of the map to the stream. It may also  write additional information about the map.<br /></p>

<MarginText>19.2/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>Map'Read reads the representation of a map from the stream, and assigns to <em>Item</em> a map with the same length and elements as was written by Map'Write.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>19.b/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>Streaming more elements than the container length is wrong. For implementation implications of this rule, see the Implementation Note in <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a>. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>19.3/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Has_Element (Position : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>19.4/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p>Returns True if Position designates an element, and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>19.c/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0005-1", "AI05-0212-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<strong>To be honest: </strong>This function might not detect cursors that designate deleted elements; such cursors are invalid (see below) and the result of calling Has_Element with an invalid cursor is unspecified (but not erroneous). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>19.5/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Has_Element (Container : Map; Position : Cursor){"\n"}   return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>19.6/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Returns True if Position designates an element in Container, and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>19.d/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>If Position is No_element, Has_Element returns False. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>20/2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function "=" (Left, Right : Map) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>21/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If Left and Right denote the same map object, then the function returns True. If Left and Right have different lengths, then the function returns False. Otherwise, for each key <em>K</em> in Left, the function returns False if:<br /></p>

<MarginText>22/2</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>a key equivalent to <em>K</em> is not present in Right; or<br /></li>
<MarginText>23/2</MarginText>
<li>the element associated with <em>K</em> in Left is not equal to the element associated with <em>K</em> in Right (using the generic formal equality operator for elements). <br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>24/2</MarginText>
<p>If the function has not returned a result after checking all of the keys, it returns True. Any exception raised during evaluation of key equivalence or element equality is propagated. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>24.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<strong></strong>This wording describes the canonical semantics. However, the order and number of calls on the formal equality function is unspecified for all of the operations that use it in this package, so an implementation can call it as many or as few times as it needs to get the correct answer. Specifically, there is no requirement to call the formal equality additional times once the answer has been determined. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>24.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited{"\n"}   (Container : Map) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>24.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Returns True if tampering with cursors or tampering with elements is currently prohibited for Container, and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>24.b/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>Prohibiting tampering with elements also needs to prohibit tampering with cursors, as deleting an element is similar to replacing it. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>24.c/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<strong></strong>Various contracts elsewhere in this specification require that this function be implemented with synchronized data. Moreover, it is possible for tampering to be prohibited by multiple operations (sequentially or in parallel). Therefore, tampering needs to be implemented with an atomic or protected counter. The counter is initialized to zero, and is incremented when tampering is prohibited, and decremented when leaving an area that prohibited tampering. Function Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited returns True if the counter is nonzero. (Note that any case where the result is not well-defined for one task is incorrect use of shared variables and would be erroneous by the rules of <a href="../AA-9/AA-9.10">9.10</a>, so no special protection is needed to read the counter.) <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>24.3/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited{"\n"}   (Container : Map) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>24.4/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Always returns False[, regardless of whether tampering with elements is prohibited].<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>24.d/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>A definite element cannot change size, so we allow operations that tamper with elements even when tampering with elements is prohibited. That's not true for the indefinite containers, which is why this kind of tampering exists. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>25/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Length (Container : Map) return Count_Type{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>26/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Returns the number of nodes in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>27/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Is_Empty (Container : Map) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Is_Empty'Result = (Length (Container) = 0);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>28/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Returns True if Container is empty .<br /></p>

<MarginText>29/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Clear (Container : in out Map){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container) = 0;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>30/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Removes all the nodes from Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>31/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Key (Position : Cursor) return Key_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} Key_Type;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>32/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Key returns the key component of the node designated by Position.<br /></p>

<MarginText>32.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Key (Container : Map;{"\n"}              Position : Cursor) return Key_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} Key_Type;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>32.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Key returns the key component of the node designated by Position.<br /></p>

<MarginText>33/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Element (Position : Cursor) return Element_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} Element_Type;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>34/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />

<MarginText>34.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Element (Container : Map;{"\n"}                  Position  : Cursor) return Element_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} Element_Type;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>34.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Element returns the element component of the node designated by Position.<br /></p>

<MarginText>35/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Replace_Element (Container : in out Map;{"\n"}                           Position  : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                           New_item  : in     Element_Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position) {"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>36/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0196-1"]} />
<p> Replace_Element assigns New_Item to the element of the node designated by Position. For the purposes of determining whether the parameters overlap in a call to Replace_Element, the Container parameter is not considered to overlap with any object [(including itself)].<br /></p>

<MarginText>37/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Query_Element{"\n"}  (Position : in Cursor;{"\n"}   Process  : not null access procedure (Key     : in Key_Type;{"\n"}                                         Element : in Element_Type)){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>38/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0021-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Query_Element calls Process.<strong>all</strong> with the key and element from the node designated by Position as the arguments. Tampering with the elements of the map that contains the element designated by Position is prohibited during the execution of the call on Process.<strong>all</strong>. Any exception raised by Process.<strong>all</strong> is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>38.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Query_Element{"\n"}  (Container : in Map;{"\n"}   Position  : in Cursor;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Key     : in Key_Type;{"\n"}                                          Element : in Element_Type)){"\n"}  with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                  or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}               (Has_Element (Container, Position) {"\n"}                  or else raise Program_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>38.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Query_Element calls Process.<strong>all</strong> with the key and element from the node designated by Position as the arguments. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited during the execution of the call on Process.<strong>all</strong>. Any exception raised by Process.<strong>all</strong> is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>39/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Update_Element{"\n"}  (Container : in out Map;{"\n"}   Position  : in     Cursor;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Key     : in     Key_Type;{"\n"}                                          Element : in out Element_Type)){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position) {"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>40/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Update_Element calls Process.<strong>all</strong> with the key and element from the node designated by Position as the arguments. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited during the execution of the call on Process.<strong>all</strong>. Any exception raised by Process.<strong>all</strong> is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>41/2</MarginText>
<p>If Element_Type is unconstrained and definite, then the actual Element parameter of Process.<strong>all</strong> shall be unconstrained.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>41.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>This means that the elements cannot be directly allocated from the heap; it must be possible to change the discriminants of the element in place. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>41.1/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
type Constant_Reference_Type{"\n"}      (Element : not null access constant Element_Type) is private{"\n"}   with Implicit_Dereference ={">"} Element,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"}in out synchronized,{"\n"}        Default_Initial_Condition ={">"} (raise Program_Error);{"\n"}
<MarginText>41.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
type Reference_Type (Element : not null access Element_Type) is private{"\n"}   with Implicit_Dereference ={">"} Element,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in out synchronized,{"\n"}        Default_Initial_Condition ={">"} (raise Program_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>41.3/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p>The types Constant_Reference_Type and Reference_Type need finalization.<br /></p>

<MarginText>41.4/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p><em>This paragraph was deleted.</em> <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>41.b/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>It is expected that Reference_Type (and Constant_Reference_Type) will be a controlled type, for which finalization will have some action to terminate the tampering check for the associated container. If the object is created by default, however, there is no associated container. Since this is useless, and supporting this case would take extra work, we define it to raise an exception. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>41.5/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Constant_Reference (Container : aliased in Map;{"\n"}                             Position  : in Cursor){"\n"}   return Constant_Reference_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>41.6/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>This function (combined with the Constant_Indexing and Implicit_Dereference aspects) provides a convenient way to gain read access to an individual element of a Map given a cursor.<br /></p>

<MarginText>41.7/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Constant_Reference returns an object whose discriminant is an access value that designates the element designated by Position. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited while the object returned by Constant_Reference exists and has not been finalized.<br /></p>

<MarginText>41.8/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Reference (Container : aliased in out Map;{"\n"}                    Position  : in Cursor){"\n"}   return Reference_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>41.9/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>This function (combined with the Variable_Indexing and Implicit_Dereference aspects) provides a convenient way to gain read and write access to an individual element of a Map given a cursor.<br /></p>

<MarginText>41.10/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Reference returns an object whose discriminant is an access value that designates the element designated by Position. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited while the object returned by Reference exists and has not been finalized.<br /></p>

<MarginText>41.11/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Constant_Reference (Container : aliased in Map;{"\n"}                             Key       : in Key_Type){"\n"}   return Constant_Reference_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Find (Container, Key) /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>41.12/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>This function (combined with the Constant_Indexing and Implicit_Dereference aspects) provides a convenient way to gain read access to an individual element of a map given a key value.<br /></p>

<MarginText>41.13/3</MarginText>
<p>Equivalent to Constant_Reference (Container, Find (Container, Key)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>41.14/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Reference (Container : aliased in out Map;{"\n"}                    Key       : in Key_Type){"\n"}   return Reference_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Find (Container, Key) /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>41.15/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>This function (combined with the Variable_Indexing and Implicit_Dereference aspects) provides a convenient way to gain read and write access to an individual element of a map given a key value.<br /></p>

<MarginText>41.16/3</MarginText>
<p>Equivalent to Reference (Container, Find (Container, Key)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>41.17/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Assign (Target : in out Map; Source : in Map){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Source) = Length (Target);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>41.18/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p>If Target denotes the same object as Source, the operation has no effect. Otherwise, the key/element pairs of Source are copied to Target as for an <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code> assigning Source to Target. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>41.c/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0005-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>This routine exists for compatibility with the bounded map containers. For an unbounded map, Assign(A, B) and A := B behave identically. For a bounded map, := will raise an exception if the container capacities are different, while Assign will not raise an exception if there is enough room in the target. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>42/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Move (Target : in out Map;{"\n"}                Source : in out Map){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Source){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if not Target'Has_Same_Storage (Source) then{"\n"}                    Length (Target) = Length (Source'Old) and then{"\n"}                    Length (Source) = 0);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>43/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>If Target denotes the same object as Source, then the operation has no effect. Otherwise, the operation is equivalent to Assign (Target, Source) followed by Clear (Source).<br /></p>

<MarginText>44/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert (Container : in out Map;{"\n"}                  Key       : in     Key_Type;{"\n"}                  New_Item  : in     Element_Type;{"\n"}                  Position  :    out Cursor;{"\n"}                  Inserted  :    out Boolean){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Count_Type'Last - 1{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (declare{"\n"}                   Original_Length : constant Count_Type :={"\n"}                      Length (Container)'Old;{"\n"}                 begin{"\n"}                   Has_Element (Container, Position) and then{"\n"}                  (if Inserted then{"\n"}                     Length (Container) = Original_Length + 1{"\n"}                   else{"\n"}                     Length (Container) = Original_Length));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>45/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Insert checks if a node with a key equivalent to Key is already present in Container. If a match is found, Inserted is set to False and Position designates the element with the matching key. Otherwise, Insert allocates a new node, initializes it to Key and New_Item, and adds it to Container; Inserted is set to True and Position designates the newly-inserted node. Any exception raised during allocation is propagated and Container is not modified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>46/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert (Container : in out Map;{"\n"}                  Key       : in     Key_Type;{"\n"}                  Position  :    out Cursor;{"\n"}                  Inserted  :    out Boolean){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Count_Type'Last - 1{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (declare{"\n"}                   Original_Length : constant Count_Type :={"\n"}                      Length (Container)'Old;{"\n"}                 begin{"\n"}                   Has_Element (Container, Position) and then{"\n"}                  (if Inserted then{"\n"}                     Length (Container) = Original_Length + 1{"\n"}                   else{"\n"}                     Length (Container) = Original_Length));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>47/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Insert inserts Key into Container as per the five-parameter Insert, with the difference that an element initialized by default (see <a href="../AA-3/AA-3.3#Subclause_3.3.1">3.3.1</a>) is inserted.<br /></p>

<MarginText>48/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert (Container : in out Map;{"\n"}                  Key       : in     Key_Type;{"\n"}                  New_Item  : in     Element_Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Count_Type'Last - 1{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container) = Length (Container)'Old + 1;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>49/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Insert inserts Key and New_Item into Container as per the five-parameter Insert, with the difference that if a node with a key equivalent to Key is already in the map, then Constraint_Error is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>49.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>This is equivalent to: <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>49.b/2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
declare{"\n"}  Inserted : Boolean; C : Cursor;{"\n"}begin{"\n"}  Insert (Container, Key, New_Item, C, Inserted);{"\n"}  if not Inserted then{"\n"}     raise Constraint_Error;{"\n"}  end if;{"\n"}end;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>49.c/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
but doesn't require the hassle of <strong>out</strong> parameters. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>50/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Include (Container : in out Map;{"\n"}                   Key       : in     Key_Type;{"\n"}                   New_Item  : in     Element_Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Count_Type'Last - 1{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (declare{"\n"}                   Original_Length : constant Count_Type :={"\n"}                      Length (Container)'Old;{"\n"}                 begin{"\n"}                   Length (Container){"\n"}                      in Original_Length | Original_Length + 1);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>51/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Include inserts Key and New_Item into Container as per the five-parameter Insert, with the difference that if a node with a key equivalent to Key is already in the map, then this operation assigns Key and New_Item to the matching node. Any exception raised during assignment is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>51.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>This is equivalent to: <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>51.b/2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
declare{"\n"}  C : Cursor := Find (Container, Key);{"\n"}begin{"\n"}  if C = No_Element then{"\n"}     Insert (Container, Key, New_Item);{"\n"}  else{"\n"}     Replace (Container, Key, New_Item);{"\n"}  end if;{"\n"}end;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>51.c/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
but this avoids doing the search twice. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>52/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Replace (Container : in out Map;{"\n"}                   Key       : in     Key_Type;{"\n"}                   New_Item  : in     Element_Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container) = Length (Container)'Old;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>53/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Replace checks if a node with a key equivalent to Key is present in Container. If a match is found, Replace assigns Key and New_Item to the matching node; otherwise, Constraint_Error is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>53.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>We update the key as well as the element, as the key might include additional information that does not participate in equivalence. If only the element needs to be updated, use Replace_Element (Find (Container, Key), New_Element). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>54/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Exclude (Container : in out Map;{"\n"}                   Key       : in     Key_Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (declare{"\n"}                   Original_Length : constant Count_Type :={"\n"}                      Length (Container)'Old;{"\n"}                 begin{"\n"}                   Length (Container){"\n"}                      in Original_Length - 1 | Original_Length);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>55/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Exclude checks if a node with a key equivalent to Key is present in Container. If a match is found, Exclude removes the node from the map.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>55.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>Exclude should work on an empty map; nothing happens in that case. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>56/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Delete (Container : in out Map;{"\n"}                  Key       : in     Key_Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container) = Length (Container)'Old - 1;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>57/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Delete checks if a node with a key equivalent to Key is present in Container. If a match is found, Delete removes the node from the map; otherwise, Constraint_Error is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>58/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Delete (Container : in out Map;{"\n"}                  Position  : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container) = Length (Container)'Old - 1 and then{"\n"}                Position = No_Element;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>59/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Delete removes the node designated by Position from the map. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>59.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>The check on Position checks that the cursor does not belong to some other map. This check implies that a reference to the map is included in the cursor value. This wording is not meant to require detection of dangling cursors; such cursors are defined to be invalid, which means that execution is erroneous, and any result is allowed (including not raising an exception). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>60/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function First (Container : Map) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if not Is_Empty (Container){"\n"}                 then Has_Element (Container, First'Result){"\n"}                 else First'Result = No_Element);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>61/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If Length (Container) = 0, then First returns No_Element. Otherwise, First returns a cursor that designates the first node in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>62/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Next (Position : Cursor) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position = No_Element then Next'Result = No_Element);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>63/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Returns a cursor that designates the successor of the node designated by Position. If Position designates the last node, then No_Element is returned. If Position equals No_Element, then No_Element is returned.<br /></p>

<MarginText>63.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Next (Container : Map;{"\n"}               Position  : Cursor) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position = No_Element or else{"\n"}                Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position = No_Element then Next'Result = No_Element{"\n"}                 elsif Next'Result = No_Element then{"\n"}                   Position = Last (Container){"\n"}                 else Has_Element (Container, Next'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>63.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Returns a cursor designating the successor of the node designated by Position in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>64/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Next (Position : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>65/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Position := Next (Position).<br /></p>

<MarginText>65.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Next (Container : in     Map;{"\n"}                Position  : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position = No_Element or else{"\n"}                Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                 then Has_Element (Container, Position));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>65.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Position := Next (Container, Position).<br /></p>

<MarginText>66/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Find (Container : Map;{"\n"}               Key       : Key_Type) return Cursor{"\n"}      with Post ={">"} (if Find'Result = No_Element{"\n"}                    then Has_Element (Container, Find'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>67/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If Length (Container) equals 0, then Find returns No_Element. Otherwise, Find checks if a node with a key equivalent to Key is present in Container. If a match is found, a cursor designating the matching node is returned; otherwise, No_Element is returned.<br /></p>

<MarginText>68/2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Element (Container : Map;{"\n"}                  Key       : Key_Type) return Element_Type;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>69/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Element (Find (Container, Key)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>70/2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Contains (Container : Map;{"\n"}                   Key       : Key_Type) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>71/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Find (Container, Key) /= No_Element.<br /></p>

<p><em>Paragraphs 72 and 73 were moved above.</em> <br /></p>

<MarginText>74/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Iterate{"\n"}  (Container : in Map;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Position : in Cursor)){"\n"}   with Allows_Exit;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>75/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0265-1"]} />
<p>Iterate calls Process.<strong>all</strong> with a cursor that designates each node in Container, starting with the first node and moving the cursor according to the successor relation. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited during the execution of a call on Process.<strong>all</strong>. Any exception raised by Process.<strong>all</strong> is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>75.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<strong></strong>The &ldquo;tamper with cursors&rdquo; check takes place when the operations that insert or delete elements, and so on, are called.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>75.b/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
See Iterate for vectors (<a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a>) for a suggested implementation of the check. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>75.1/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<p>The nested package Stable provides a type Stable.Map that represents a <em>stable</em> map, which is one that cannot grow and shrink. Such a map can be created by calling the Copy function, or by establishing a <em>stabilized view</em> of an ordinary map.<br /></p>

<MarginText>75.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<p>The subprograms of the map package that have a parameter or result of type Map are included in the nested package Stable with the same specification, except that the following are omitted:<br /></p>

<MarginText>75.3/5</MarginText>
<p>Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited, Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited, Assign, Move, Insert, Include, Clear, Delete, Exclude, (for Ordered_Maps) Delete_First and Delete_Last, and (for Hashed_Maps) Reserve_Capacity <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>75.b.1/5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>The names Map and Cursor mean the types declared in the nested package in these subprogram specifications. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>75.b.2/5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>The omitted routines are those that tamper with cursors or elements (or test that state). The model is that it is impossible to tamper with cursors or elements of a stable view since no such operations are included. Thus tampering checks are not needed for a stable view, and we omit the operations associated with those checks. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>75.4/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<p>The operations of this package are equivalent to those for ordinary maps, except that the calls to Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited and Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited that occur in preconditions are replaced by False, and any that occur in postconditions are replaced by True.<br /></p>

<MarginText>75.5/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0439-1"]} />
<p>If a stable map is declared with the Base discriminant designating a pre-existing ordinary map, the stable map represents a stabilized view of the underlying ordinary map, and any operation on the stable map is reflected on the underlying ordinary map. While a stabilized view exists, any operation that tampers with elements performed on the underlying map is prohibited. The finalization of a stable map that provides such a view removes this restriction on the underlying ordinary map [(though some other restriction can exist due to other concurrent iterations or stabilized views)].<br /></p>

<MarginText>75.6/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0438-1"]} />
<p>If a stable map is declared without specifying Base, the object is necessarily initialized. The initializing expression of the stable map, [typically a call on Copy], determines the Length of the map. The Length of a stable map never changes after initialization.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>75.c/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0438-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="proof">
<strong></strong>Initialization is required as the type is indefinite, see <a href="../AA-3/AA-3.3#Subclause_3.3.1">3.3.1</a>. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Bounded (Run-Time) Errors

<MarginText>75.7/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0022-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p>It is a bounded error for the actual function associated with a generic formal subprogram, when called as part of an operation of a map package, to tamper with elements of any map parameter of the operation. Either Program_Error is raised, or the operation works as defined on the value of the map either prior to, or subsequent to, some or all of the modifications to the map.<br /></p>

<MarginText>75.8/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0027-1"]} />
<p>It is a bounded error to call any subprogram declared in the visible part of a map package when the associated container has been finalized. If the operation takes Container as an <strong>in out</strong> parameter, then it raises Constraint_Error or Program_Error. Otherwise, the operation either proceeds as it would for an empty container, or it raises Constraint_Error or Program_Error. <br /></p>


#### Erroneous Execution

<MarginText>76/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>A Cursor value is <em>invalid</em> if any of the following have occurred since it was created: <br /></p>

<MarginText>77/2</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The map that contains the node it designates has been finalized;<br /></li>
<MarginText>77.1/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1"]} />
<li>The map that contains the node it designates has been used as the Target of a call to Assign, or as the target of an <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code>;<br /></li>
<MarginText>78/2</MarginText>
<li>The map that contains the node it designates has been used as the Source or Target of a call to Move; or<br /></li>
<MarginText>79/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<li>The node it designates has been removed from the map that previously contained the node. <br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>79.a/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>This can happen directly via calls to Clear, Exclude, and Delete. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>80/2</MarginText>
<p>The result of "=" or Has_Element is unspecified if these functions are called with an invalid cursor parameter. Execution is erroneous if any other subprogram declared in Containers.Hashed_Maps or Containers.Ordered_Maps is called with an invalid cursor parameter.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>80.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>The list above is intended to be exhaustive. In other cases, a cursor value continues to designate its original element. For instance, cursor values survive the insertion and deletion of other nodes.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>80.b/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
While it is possible to check for these cases, in many cases the overhead necessary to make the check is substantial in time or space. Implementations are encouraged to check for as many of these cases as possible and raise Program_Error if detected. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>80.1/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p>Execution is erroneous if the map associated with the result of a call to Reference or Constant_Reference is finalized before the result object returned by the call to Reference or Constant_Reference is finalized. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>80.c/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>Each object of Reference_Type and Constant_Reference_Type probably contains some reference to the originating container. If that container is prematurely finalized (which is only possible via Unchecked_Deallocation, as accessibility checks prevent passing a container to Reference that will not live as long as the result), the finalization of the object of Reference_Type will try to access a nonexistent object. This is a normal case of a dangling pointer created by Unchecked_Deallocation; we have to explicitly mention it here as the pointer in question is not visible in the specification of the type. (This is the same reason we have to say this for invalid cursors.) <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Implementation Requirements

<MarginText>81/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0437-1"]} />
<p>No storage associated with a map  object shall be lost upon assignment or scope exit.<br /></p>

<MarginText>82/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>The execution of an <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code> for a map shall have the effect of copying the elements from the source map object to the target map object and changing the length of the target object to that of the source object.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>82.a/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0298-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<strong></strong>An assignment of a Map is a &ldquo;deep&rdquo; copy; that is the elements are copied as well as the data structures. We say &ldquo;effect of&rdquo; in order to allow the implementation to avoid copying elements immediately if it wishes. For instance, an implementation that avoided copying until one of the containers is modified would be allowed. (Note that this implementation would require care, see <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a> for more.) <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Implementation Advice

<MarginText>83/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Move should not copy elements, and should minimize copying of internal data structures. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>83.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<strong></strong>Move for a map should not copy elements, and should minimize copying of internal data structures.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>83.b/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<strong></strong>Usually that can be accomplished simply by moving the pointer(s) to the internal data structures from the Source container to the Target container. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>84/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If an exception is propagated from a map operation, no storage should be lost, nor any elements removed from a map unless specified by the operation. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>84.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<strong></strong>If an exception is propagated from a map operation, no storage should be lost, nor any elements removed from a map unless specified by the operation.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>84.b/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>This is important so that programs can recover from errors. But we don't want to require heroic efforts, so we just require documentation of cases where this can't be accomplished. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Wording Changes from Ada 95

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>84.c/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
This description of maps is new; the extensions are documented with the specific packages. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>84.d/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Added reference support to make map containers more convenient to use. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Wording Changes from Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>84.e/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Added procedure Assign; the extension and incompatibility is documented with the specific packages.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>84.f/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Generalized the definition of Move. Specified which elements are read/written by stream attributes.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>84.g/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0022-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<strong></strong> Added a Bounded (Run-Time) Error to cover tampering by generic actual subprograms.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>84.h/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0027-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<strong></strong> Added a Bounded (Run-Time) Error to cover access to finalized map containers.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>84.i/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<strong></strong> Revised the definition of invalid cursors to cover missing (and new) cases.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>84.j/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0265-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<strong></strong> Defined when a container prohibits tampering in order to more clearly define where the check is made and the exception raised. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Inconsistencies With Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>84.k/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<strong></strong> Tampering with elements is now defined to be equivalent to tampering with cursors for ordinary containers. If a program requires tampering detection to work, it might fail in Ada 2022. Needless to say, this shouldn't happen outside of test programs. See Inconsistencies With Ada 2012 in <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a> for more details. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>84.l/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0196-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<strong></strong> Replace_Element is now defined such that it can be used concurrently so long as it operates on different elements. This allows some container operations to be used in parallel without separate synchronization. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Wording Changes from Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>84.m/4</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0110-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<strong></strong> Clarified that tampering checks precede all other checks made by a subprogram (but come after those associated with the call).<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>84.n/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Added contracts to this container. This includes describing some of the semantics with pre- and postconditions, rather than English text. Note that the preconditions can be Suppressed (see <a href="../AA-11/AA-11.5">11.5</a>). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<a id="Subclause_A.18.5"></a>

## A.18.5  The Generic Package Containers.Hashed_Maps


#### Static Semantics

<MarginText>1/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The generic library package Containers.Hashed_Maps has the following declaration: <br /></p>

<MarginText>2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0084-1", "AI05-0212-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
with Ada.Iterator_Interfaces;{"\n"}generic{"\n"}   type Key_Type is private;{"\n"}   type Element_Type is private;{"\n"}   with function Hash (Key : Key_Type) return Hash_Type;{"\n"}   with function Equivalent_Keys (Left, Right : Key_Type){"\n"}      return Boolean;{"\n"}   with function "=" (Left, Right : Element_Type){"\n"}      return Boolean is {"<"}{">"};{"\n"}package Ada.Containers.Hashed_Maps {"\n"}   with Preelaborate, Remote_Types,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in out synchronized is {"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>2.a/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>For discussion on the reasons and meaning of the specifications of the Global and Nonblocking aspects in this generic package, see the notes on the equivalent operations in the specification of the Containers.Vectors package (see <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a>). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>3/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0212-1", "AI12-0339-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
   type Map is tagged private{"\n"}      with Constant_Indexing ={">"} Constant_Reference,{"\n"}           Variable_Indexing ={">"} Reference,{"\n"}           Default_Iterator  ={">"} Iterate,{"\n"}           Iterator_Element  ={">"} Element_Type,{"\n"}           Iterator_View     ={">"} Stable.Map,{"\n"}           Aggregate         ={">"} (Empty     ={">"} Empty,{"\n"}                                 Add_Named ={">"} Insert),{"\n"}           Stable_Properties ={">"} (Length,{"\n"}                                 Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited,{"\n"}                                 Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited),{"\n"}           Default_Initial_Condition ={">"}{"\n"}              Length (Map) = 0 and then{"\n"}              (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Map)) and then{"\n"}              (not Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited (Map)), {"\n"}            Preelaborable_Initialization ;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>3.a/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>Unlike a Vector, the Stable_Properties of a Hashed_Map do not include the Capacity. If we had included it, some of the otherwise shared definitions would need different postconditions for Hashed_Maps and Ordered_Maps. If we were starting these containers from scratch, we probably would have approached the sharing of definitions differently so that we could avoid issues like this, but a major reorganization of this existing material would be too much change. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>4/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0399-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
   type Cursor is private {"\n"}      with  Preelaborable_Initialization ;{"\n"}
<MarginText>5/2</MarginText>
   Empty_Map : constant Map;{"\n"}
<MarginText>6/2</MarginText>
   No_Element : constant Cursor;{"\n"}
<MarginText>6.1/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
   function Has_Element (Position : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}      with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}
<MarginText>6.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
   function Has_Element (Container : Map; Position : Cursor){"\n"}      return Boolean{"\n"}      with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}
<MarginText>6.3/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
   package Map_Iterator_Interfaces is new{"\n"}       Ada.Iterator_Interfaces (Cursor, Has_Element);{"\n"}
<MarginText>7/2</MarginText>
   function "=" (Left, Right : Map) return Boolean;{"\n"}
<MarginText>7.1/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
   function Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited{"\n"}      (Container : Map) return Boolean{"\n"}      with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}
<MarginText>7.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
   function Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited{"\n"}      (Container : Map) return Boolean{"\n"}      with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}
<MarginText>7.3/5</MarginText>
