<a id="Subclause_A.18.7"></a>

## A.18.7  Sets

<MarginText>1/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The language-defined generic packages Containers.Hashed_Sets and Containers.Ordered_Sets provide private types Set and Cursor, and a set of operations for each type. A set container allows elements of an arbitrary type to be stored without duplication. A hashed set uses a hash function to organize elements, while an ordered set orders its element per a specified relation. <br /></p>

<MarginText>2/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0299-1"]} />
<p>This subclause describes the declarations that are common to both kinds of sets. See <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.8">A.18.8</a> for a description of the semantics specific to Containers.Hashed_Sets and <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.9">A.18.9</a> for a description of the semantics specific to Containers.Ordered_Sets. <br /></p>


#### Static Semantics

<MarginText>3/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The actual function for the generic formal function "=" on Element_Type values is expected to define a reflexive and symmetric relationship and return the same result value each time it is called with a particular pair of values. If it behaves in some other manner, the function "=" on set values returns an unspecified value. The exact arguments and number of calls of this generic formal function by the function "=" on set values are unspecified.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>3.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>If the actual function for "=" is not symmetric and consistent, the result returned by the "=" for Set objects cannot be predicted. The implementation is not required to protect against "=" raising an exception, or returning random results, or any other &ldquo;bad&rdquo; behavior. And it can call "=" in whatever manner makes sense. But note that only the result of "=" for Set objects is unspecified; other subprograms are not allowed to break if "=" is bad (they aren't expected to use "="). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>4/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The type Set is used to represent sets. The type Set needs finalization (see <a href="../AA-7/AA-7.6">7.6</a>).<br /></p>

<MarginText>5/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>A set contains elements. Set cursors designate elements. There exists an equivalence relation on elements, whose definition is different for hashed sets and ordered sets. A set never contains two or more equivalent elements. The <em>length</em> of a set is the number of elements it contains.<br /></p>

<MarginText>6/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Each nonempty set has two particular elements called the <em>first element</em> and the <em>last element</em> (which may be the same). Each element except for the last element has a <em>successor element</em>. If there are no other intervening operations, starting with the first element and repeatedly going to the successor element will visit each element in the set exactly once until the last element is reached. The exact definition of these terms is different for hashed sets and ordered sets.<br /></p>

<MarginText>7/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>[Some operations  check for &ldquo;tampering with cursors&rdquo; of a container because they depend on the set of elements of the container remaining constant and   on elements of the container not being replaced.] When tampering with cursors is <em>prohibited</em> for a particular set object <em>S</em>, Program_Error is propagated by the finalization of <em>S</em>[, as well as by a call that passes <em>S</em> to certain of the operations of this package, as indicated by the precondition of such an operation].<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>7.a/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>Note that Replace_Element tampers with cursors because it might delete and reinsert the element if it moves in the set. That could change the order of iteration, which is what this check is designed to prevent. Replace also tampers with cursors, as it is defined in terms of Replace_Element.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>7.b/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
These inclusions mean that there are no operations that would tamper with elements that do not tamper with cursors. As such, we do not define tampering with elements at all for set containers. Earlier versions of Ada did so just so the description of subprograms are the same between containers, but since we've changed those to pre- and postconditions which are necessarily specific to each container, there no longer seems to be any reason to define tampering with elements for sets. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<p><em>Paragraphs 8 through 14 are removed as preconditions now describe these rules.</em> <br /></p>

<MarginText>8/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> <br /></p>

<MarginText>9/5</MarginText>
<ul>
<li> <br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>9.a/5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<strong>To be honest: </strong> <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>9.b/5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong> <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>10/5</MarginText>
<ul>
<li> <br /></li>
<MarginText>10.1/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<li> <br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>10.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>We don't need to explicitly mention <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code>, because that finalizes the target object as part of the operation, and finalization of an object is already defined as tampering with cursors. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>11/5</MarginText>
<ul>
<li> <br /></li>
<MarginText>12/5</MarginText>
<li> <br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>13/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> <br /></p>

<MarginText>14/5</MarginText>
<ul>
<li> <br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>14.a/5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong> <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>14.b/5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
 <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>14.1/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0110-1", "AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>14.c/5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="proof">
<strong></strong> <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>15/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Empty_Set represents the empty Set object. It has a length of 0. If an object of type Set is not otherwise initialized, it is initialized to the same value as Empty_Set.<br /></p>

<MarginText>16/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>No_Element represents a cursor that designates no element. If an object of type Cursor is not otherwise initialized, it is initialized to the same value as No_Element.<br /></p>

<MarginText>17/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0434-1"]} />
<p>The primitive  "=" operator for type Cursor returns True if both cursors are No_Element, or designate the same element in the same container.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>17.a/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0434-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<strong>To be honest: </strong>&ldquo;The primitive "=" operator&rdquo; is the one with two parameters of type Cursor which returns Boolean. We're not talking about some other (hidden) primitive function named "=". <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>18/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Execution of the default implementation of the Input, Output, Read, or Write attribute of type Cursor raises Program_Error.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>18.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>A cursor will probably be implemented in terms of one or more access values, and the effects of streaming access values is unspecified. Rather than letting the user stream junk by accident, we mandate that streaming of cursors raise Program_Error by default. The attributes can always be specified if there is a need to support streaming. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>18.1/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI12-0437-1"]} />
<p>Set'Write for a Set object <em>S</em> writes Length(<em>S</em>) elements of the set to the stream. It may also  write additional information about the set.<br /></p>

<MarginText>18.2/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>Set'Read reads the representation of a set from the stream, and assigns to <em>Item</em> a set with the same length and elements as was written by Set'Write.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>18.b/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>Streaming more elements than the container length is wrong. For implementation implications of this rule, see the Implementation Note in <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a>. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>18.3/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Has_Element (Position : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>18.4/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p>Returns True if Position designates an element, and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>18.c/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0005-1", "AI05-0212-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<strong>To be honest: </strong>This function might not detect cursors that designate deleted elements; such cursors are invalid (see below) and the result of calling Has_Element with an invalid cursor is unspecified (but not erroneous). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>18.5/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Has_Element (Container : Set; Position : Cursor){"\n"}   return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>18.6/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Returns True if Position designates an element in Container, and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>18.d/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>If Position is No_Element, Has_Element returns False. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>19/2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function "=" (Left, Right : Set) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>20/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If Left and Right denote the same set object, then the function returns True. If Left and Right have different lengths, then the function returns False. Otherwise, for each element <em>E</em> in Left, the function returns False if an element equal to <em>E</em> (using the generic formal equality operator) is not present in Right. If the function has not returned a result after checking all of the elements, it returns True. Any exception raised during evaluation of element equality is propagated. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>20.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<strong></strong>This wording describes the canonical semantics. However, the order and number of calls on the formal equality function is unspecified for all of the operations that use it in this package, so an implementation can call it as many or as few times as it needs to get the correct answer. Specifically, there is no requirement to call the formal equality additional times once the answer has been determined. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>21/2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Equivalent_Sets (Left, Right : Set) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>22/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If Left and Right denote the same set object, then the function returns True. If Left and Right have different lengths, then the function returns False. Otherwise, for each element <em>E</em> in Left, the function returns False if an element equivalent to <em>E</em> is not present in Right. If the function has not returned a result after checking all of the elements, it returns True. Any exception raised during evaluation of element equivalence is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>22.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited{"\n"}   (Container : Set) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>22.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Returns True if tampering with cursors is currently prohibited for Container, and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>22.a/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<strong></strong>Various contracts elsewhere in this specification require that this function be implemented with synchronized data. Moreover, it is possible for tampering to be prohibited by multiple operations (sequentially or in parallel). Therefore, tampering needs to be implemented with an atomic or protected counter. The counter is initialized to zero, and is incremented when tampering is prohibited, and decremented when leaving an area that prohibited tampering. Function Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited returns True if the counter is nonzero. (Note that any case where the result is not well-defined for one task is incorrect use of shared variables and would be erroneous by the rules of <a href="../AA-9/AA-9.10">9.10</a>, so no special protection is needed to read the counter.) <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>23/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function To_Set (New_Item : Element_Type) return Set{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} Length (To_Set'Result) = 1 and then{"\n"}              not Tampering_with_Cursors_Prohibited (To_Set'Result);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>24/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Returns a set containing the single element New_Item.<br /></p>

<MarginText>25/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Length (Container : Set) return Count_Type{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>26/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Returns the number of elements in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>27/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Is_Empty (Container : Set) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Is_Empty'Result = (Length (Container) = 0);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>28/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Returns True if Container is empty .<br /></p>

<MarginText>29/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Clear (Container : in out Set){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container) = 0;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>30/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Removes all the elements from Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>31/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Element (Position : Cursor) return Element_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Position /= No_Element or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} Element_Type;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>32/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Element returns the element designated by Position.<br /></p>

<MarginText>32.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Element (Container : Set;{"\n"}                  Position  : Cursor) return Element_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} Element_Type;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>32.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Element returns the element designated by Position.<br /></p>

<MarginText>33/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Replace_Element (Container : in out Set;{"\n"}                           Position  : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                           New_item  : in     Element_Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position) {"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>34/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0196-1"]} />
<p> Replace_Element assigns New_Item to the element designated by Position. Any exception raised by the assignment is propagated. For the purposes of determining whether the parameters overlap in a call to Replace_Element, the Container parameter is not considered to overlap with any object [(including itself)].<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>34.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<strong></strong>The final assignment may require that the node of the element be moved in the Set's data structures. That could mean that implementing this operation exactly as worded above could require the overhead of searching twice. Implementations are encouraged to avoid this extra overhead when possible, by prechecking if the old element is equivalent to the new one, by inserting a placeholder node while checking for an equivalent element, and similar optimizations.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>34.b/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The cursor still designates the same element after this operation; only the value of that element has changed. Cursors cannot include information about the relative position of an element in a Set (as they must survive insertions and deletions of other elements), so this should not pose an implementation hardship. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>35/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Query_Element{"\n"}  (Position : in Cursor;{"\n"}   Process  : not null access procedure (Element : in Element_Type)){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>36/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0021-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Query_Element calls Process.<strong>all</strong> with the element designated by Position as the argument. Tampering with the elements of the set that contains the element designated by Position is prohibited during the execution of the call on Process.<strong>all</strong>. Any exception raised by Process.<strong>all</strong> is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>36.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Query_Element{"\n"}  (Container : in Set;{"\n"}   Position  : in Cursor;{"\n"}   Process  : not null access procedure (Element : in Element_Type)){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position) {"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>36.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Query_Element calls Process.<strong>all</strong> with the key and element from the node designated by Position as the arguments. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited during the execution of the call on Process.<strong>all</strong>. Any exception raised by Process.<strong>all</strong> is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>36.3/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
type Constant_Reference_Type{"\n"}      (Element : not null access constant Element_Type) is private{"\n"}   with Implicit_Dereference ={">"} Element,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in out synchronized,{"\n"}        Default_Initial_Condition ={">"} (raise Program_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>36.4/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p>The type Constant_Reference_Type needs finalization.<br /></p>

<MarginText>36.5/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p><em>This paragraph was deleted.</em> <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>36.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>It is expected that Constant_Reference_Type will be a controlled type, for which finalization will have some action to terminate the tampering check for the associated container. If the object is created by default, however, there is no associated container. Since this is useless, and supporting this case would take extra work, we define it to raise an exception. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>36.6/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Constant_Reference (Container : aliased in Set;{"\n"}                             Position  : in Cursor){"\n"}   return Constant_Reference_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>36.7/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>This function (combined with the Constant_Indexing and Implicit_Dereference aspects) provides a convenient way to gain read access to an individual element of a set given a cursor.<br /></p>

<MarginText>36.8/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Constant_Reference returns an object whose discriminant is an access value that designates the element designated by Position. Tampering with the cursors  of Container is prohibited while the object returned by Constant_Reference exists and has not been finalized.<br /></p>

<MarginText>36.9/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Assign (Target : in out Set; Source : in Set){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Source) = Length (Target);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>36.10/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p>If Target denotes the same object as Source, the operation has no effect. Otherwise, the elements of Source are copied to Target as for an <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code> assigning Source to Target. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>36.b/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0005-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>This routine exists for compatibility with the bounded set containers. For an unbounded set, Assign(A, B) and A := B behave identically. For a bounded set, := will raise an exception if the container capacities are different, while Assign will not raise an exception if there is enough room in the target. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>37/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Move (Target : in out Set;{"\n"}                Source : in out Set){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Source){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if not Target'Has_Same_Storage (Source) then{"\n"}                    Length (Target) = Length (Source'Old) and then{"\n"}                    Length (Source) = 0);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>38/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>If Target denotes the same object as Source, then the operation has no effect. Otherwise, the operation is equivalent to Assign (Target, Source) followed by Clear (Source).<br /></p>

<MarginText>39/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert (Container : in out Set;{"\n"}                  New_Item  : in     Element_Type;{"\n"}                  Position  :    out Cursor;{"\n"}                  Inserted  :    out Boolean){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Count_Type'Last - 1{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (declare{"\n"}                   Original_Length : constant Count_Type :={"\n"}                      Length (Container)'Old;{"\n"}                 begin{"\n"}                   Has_Element (Container, Position) and then{"\n"}                  (if Inserted then{"\n"}                     Length (Container) = Original_Length + 1{"\n"}                   else{"\n"}                     Length (Container) = Original_Length));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>40/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Insert checks if an element equivalent to New_Item is already present in Container. If a match is found, Inserted is set to False and Position designates the matching element. Otherwise, Insert adds New_Item to Container; Inserted is set to True and Position designates the newly-inserted element. Any exception raised during allocation is propagated and Container is not modified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>41/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert (Container : in out Set;{"\n"}                  New_Item  : in     Element_Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Count_Type'Last - 1{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container) = Length (Container)'Old + 1;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>42/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Insert inserts New_Item into Container as per the four-parameter Insert, with the difference that if an element equivalent to New_Item is already in the set, then Constraint_Error is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>42.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>This is equivalent to: <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>42.b/2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
declare{"\n"}  Inserted : Boolean; C : Cursor;{"\n"}begin{"\n"}  Insert (Container, New_Item, C, Inserted);{"\n"}  if not Inserted then{"\n"}     raise Constraint_Error;{"\n"}  end if;{"\n"}end;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>42.c/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
but doesn't require the hassle of <strong>out</strong> parameters. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>43/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Include (Container : in out Set;{"\n"}                   New_Item  : in     Element_Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Count_Type'Last - 1{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (declare{"\n"}                   Original_Length : constant Count_Type :={"\n"}                      Length (Container)'Old;{"\n"}                 begin{"\n"}                   Length (Container){"\n"}                      in Original_Length | Original_Length + 1);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>44/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Include inserts New_Item into Container as per the four-parameter Insert, with the difference that if an element equivalent to New_Item is already in the set, then it is replaced. Any exception raised during assignment is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>45/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Replace (Container : in out Set;{"\n"}                   New_Item  : in     Element_Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container) = Length (Container)'Old;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>46/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Replace checks if an element equivalent to New_Item is already in the set. If a match is found, that element is replaced with New_Item; otherwise, Constraint_Error is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>47/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Exclude (Container : in out Set;{"\n"}                   Item       : in     Element_Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (declare{"\n"}                   Original_Length : constant Count_Type :={"\n"}                      Length (Container)'Old;{"\n"}                 begin{"\n"}                   Length (Container) in{"\n"}                      Original_Length - 1 | Original_Length);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>48/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Exclude checks if an element equivalent to Item is present in Container. If a match is found, Exclude removes the element from the set.<br /></p>

<MarginText>49/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Delete (Container : in out Set;{"\n"}                  Item       : in     Element_Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container) = Length (Container)'Old - 1;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>50/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Delete checks if an element equivalent to Item is present in Container. If a match is found, Delete removes the element from the set; otherwise, Constraint_Error is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>51/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Delete (Container : in out Set;{"\n"}                  Position  : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container) = Length (Container)'Old - 1 and then{"\n"}                Position = No_Element;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>52/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Delete removes the element designated by Position from the set. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>52.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>The check on Position checks that the cursor does not belong to some other set. This check implies that a reference to the set is included in the cursor value. This wording is not meant to require detection of dangling cursors; such cursors are defined to be invalid, which means that execution is erroneous, and any result is allowed (including not raising an exception). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>53/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Union (Target : in out Set;{"\n"}                 Source : in     Set){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Target) {"<"}= Length (Target)'Old + Length (Source);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>54/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Union inserts into Target the elements of Source that are not equivalent to some element already in Target.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>54.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<strong></strong>If the objects are the same, the result is the same as the original object. The implementation needs to take care so that aliasing effects do not make the result trash; Union (S, S); must work. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>55/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Union (Left, Right : Set) return Set{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} Length (Union'Result) {"<"}= {"\n"}                   Length (Left) + Length (Right) and then{"\n"}                not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Union'Result);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>56/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Returns a set comprising all of the elements of Left, and the elements of Right that are not equivalent to some element of Left.<br /></p>

<MarginText>57/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Intersection (Target : in out Set;{"\n"}                        Source : in     Set){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Target) {"<"}= Length (Target)'Old + Length (Source);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>58/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0004-1"]} />
<p>Intersection deletes from Target the elements of Target that are not equivalent to some element of Source.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>58.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<strong></strong>If the objects are the same, the result is the same as the original object. The implementation needs to take care so that aliasing effects do not make the result trash; Intersection (S, S); must work. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>59/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Intersection (Left, Right : Set) return Set{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} Length (Intersection'Result) {"<"}= {"\n"}                   Length (Left) + Length (Right) and then{"\n"}                not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Intersection'Result);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>60/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Returns a set comprising all the elements of Left that are equivalent to the some element of Right.<br /></p>

<MarginText>61/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Difference (Target : in out Set;{"\n"}                      Source : in     Set){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Target) {"<"}= Length (Target)'Old + Length (Source);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>62/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If Target denotes the same object as Source, then Difference clears Target. Otherwise, it deletes from Target the elements that are equivalent to some element of Source.<br /></p>

<MarginText>63/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Difference (Left, Right : Set) return Set{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} Length (Difference'Result) {"<"}= Length (Left) + {"\n"}                   Length (Right) and then{"\n"}                not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Difference'Result);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>64/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Returns a set comprising the elements of Left that are not equivalent to some element of Right.<br /></p>

<MarginText>65/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Symmetric_Difference (Target : in out Set;{"\n"}                                Source : in     Set){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Target) {"<"}= Length (Target)'Old + Length (Source);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>66/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If Target denotes the same object as Source, then Symmetric_Difference clears Target. Otherwise, it deletes from Target the elements that are equivalent to some element of Source, and inserts into Target the elements of Source that are not equivalent to some element of Target.<br /></p>

<MarginText>67/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Symmetric_Difference (Left, Right : Set) return Set{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} Length (Symmetric_Difference'Result) {"<"}= {"\n"}                   Length (Left) + Length (Right) and then{"\n"}                not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited ({"\n"}                   Symmetric_Difference'Result);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>68/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Returns a set comprising the elements of Left that are not equivalent to some element of Right, and the elements of Right that are not equivalent to some element of Left.<br /></p>

<MarginText>69/2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Overlap (Left, Right : Set) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>70/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p>If an element of Left is equivalent to some element of Right, then Overlap returns True. Otherwise, it returns False.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>70.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>This operation is commutative. If Overlap returns False, the two sets are disjoint. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>71/2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Is_Subset (Subset : Set;{"\n"}                    Of_Set : Set) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>72/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p>If an element of Subset is not equivalent to some element of Of_Set, then Is_Subset returns False. Otherwise, it returns True.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>72.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>This operation is not commutative, so we use parameter names that make it clear in named notation which set is which. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>73/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function First (Container : Set) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if not Is_Empty (Container){"\n"}                 then Has_Element (Container, First'Result){"\n"}                 else First'Result = No_Element);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>74/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If Length (Container) = 0, then First returns No_Element. Otherwise, First returns a cursor that designates the first element in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>75/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Next (Position : Cursor) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position = No_Element then Next'Result = No_Element);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>76/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Returns a cursor that designates the successor of the element designated by Position. If Position designates the last element, then No_Element is returned. If Position equals No_Element, then No_Element is returned.<br /></p>

<MarginText>76.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Next (Container : Set;{"\n"}               Position  : Cursor) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position = No_Element or else{"\n"}                Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position = No_Element then Next'Result = No_Element{"\n"}                 elsif Next'Result = No_Element then{"\n"}                   Position = Last (Container){"\n"}                 else Has_Element (Container, Next'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>76.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Returns a cursor designating the successor of the node designated by Position in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>77/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Next (Position : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>78/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Position := Next (Position).<br /></p>

<MarginText>78.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Next (Container : in     Set;{"\n"}                Position  : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position = No_Element or else{"\n"}                Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                 then Has_Element (Container, Position));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>78.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Position := Next (Container, Position).<br /></p>

<MarginText>79/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0004-1"]} />
<p><em>This paragraph was deleted.</em><br /></p>

<MarginText>80/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Find (Container : Set;{"\n"}               Item      : Element_Type) return Cursor{"\n"}      with Post ={">"} (if Find'Result /= No_Element{"\n"}                    then Has_Element (Container, Find'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>81/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If Length (Container) equals 0, then Find returns No_Element. Otherwise, Find checks if an element equivalent to Item is present in Container. If a match is found, a cursor designating the matching element is returned; otherwise, No_Element is returned.<br /></p>

<MarginText>82/2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Contains (Container : Set;{"\n"}                   Item      : Element_Type) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>82.1/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0004-1"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Find (Container, Item) /= No_Element.<br /></p>

<p><em>Paragraphs 83 and 84 were moved above.</em> <br /></p>

<MarginText>85/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Iterate{"\n"}  (Container : in Set;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Position : in Cursor)){"\n"}   with Allows_Exit;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>86/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0265-1"]} />
<p>Iterate calls Process.<strong>all</strong> with a cursor that designates each element in Container, starting with the first element and moving the cursor according to the successor relation. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited during the execution of a call on Process.<strong>all</strong>. Any exception raised by Process.<strong>all</strong> is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>86.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<strong></strong>The &ldquo;tamper with cursors&rdquo; check takes place when the operations that insert or delete elements, and so on are called.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>86.b/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
See Iterate for vectors (<a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a>) for a suggested implementation of the check. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>87/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Both Containers.Hashed_Set and Containers.Ordered_Set declare a nested generic package Generic_Keys, which provides operations that allow set manipulation in terms of a key (typically, a portion of an element) instead of a complete element. The formal function Key of Generic_Keys extracts a key value from an element. It is expected to return the same value each time it is called with a particular element. The behavior of Generic_Keys is unspecified if Key behaves in some other manner.<br /></p>

<MarginText>88/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>A key is expected to unambiguously determine a single equivalence class for elements. The behavior of Generic_Keys is unspecified if the formal parameters of this package behave in some other manner.<br /></p>

<MarginText>89/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Key (Position : Cursor) return Key_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Position /= No_Element or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>90/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Key (Element (Position)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>90.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Key (Container : Set;{"\n"}              Position : Cursor) return Key_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>90.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Key (Element (Container, Position)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>91/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The subprograms in package Generic_Keys named Contains, Find, Element, Delete, and Exclude, are equivalent to the corresponding subprograms in the parent package, with the difference that the Key parameter is used to locate an element in the set.<br /></p>

<MarginText>92/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Replace (Container : in out Set;{"\n"}                   Key       : in     Key_Type;{"\n"}                   New_Item  : in     Element_Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container) = Length (Container)'Old;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>93/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Replace_Element (Container, Find (Container, Key), New_Item).<br /></p>

<MarginText>94/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Update_Element_Preserving_Key{"\n"}  (Container : in out Set;{"\n"}   Position  : in     Cursor;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure{"\n"}                                 (Element : in out Element_Type)){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position) {"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>95/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Update_Element_Preserving_Key uses Key to save the key value <em>K</em> of the element designated by Position. Update_Element_Preserving_Key then calls Process.<strong>all</strong> with that element as the argument. Tampering with the cursors  of Container is prohibited during the execution of the call on Process.<strong>all</strong>. Any exception raised by Process.<strong>all</strong> is propagated. After Process.<strong>all</strong> returns, Update_Element_Preserving_Key checks if <em>K</em> determines the same equivalence class as that for the new element; if not, the element is removed from the set and Program_Error is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>95.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>The key check ensures that the invariants of the set are preserved by the modification. The &ldquo;tampers with the elements&rdquo; check prevents data loss (if Element_Type is by-copy) or erroneous execution (if element type is unconstrained and indefinite). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>96/2</MarginText>
<p>If Element_Type is unconstrained and definite, then the actual Element parameter of Process.<strong>all</strong> shall be unconstrained.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>96.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>This means that the elements cannot be directly allocated from the heap; it must be possible to change the discriminants of the element in place. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>96.1/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
type Reference_Type (Element : not null access Element_Type) is private{"\n"}   with Implicit_Dereference ={">"} Element,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in out synchronized,{"\n"}        Default_Initial_Condition ={">"} (raise Program_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>96.2/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p>The type Reference_Type needs finalization.<br /></p>

<MarginText>96.3/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p><em>This paragraph was deleted.</em> <br /></p>

<MarginText>96.4/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Reference_Preserving_Key (Container : aliased in out Set;{"\n"}                                   Position  : in Cursor){"\n"}   return Reference_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>96.5/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>This function (combined with the Implicit_Dereference aspect) provides a convenient way to gain read and write access to an individual element of a set given a cursor.<br /></p>

<MarginText>96.6/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Reference_Preserving_Key uses Key to save the key value <em>K</em>; then returns an object whose discriminant is an access value that designates the element designated by Position. Tampering with the cursors  of Container is prohibited while the object returned by Reference_Preserving_Key exists and has not been finalized. When the object returned by Reference_Preserving_Key is finalized, a check is made if <em>K</em> determines the same equivalence class as that for the new element; if not, the element is removed from the set and Program_Error is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>96.7/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Constant_Reference (Container : aliased in Set;{"\n"}                             Key       : in Key_Type){"\n"}   return Constant_Reference_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Find (Container, Key) /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>96.8/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>This function (combined with the Implicit_Dereference aspect) provides a convenient way to gain read access to an individual element of a set given a key value.<br /></p>

<MarginText>96.9/3</MarginText>
<p>Equivalent to Constant_Reference (Container, Find (Container, Key)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>96.10/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Reference_Preserving_Key (Container : aliased in out Set;{"\n"}                                   Key       : in Key_Type){"\n"}   return Reference_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Find (Container, Key) /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>96.11/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>This function (combined with the Implicit_Dereference aspect) provides a convenient way to gain read and write access to an individual element of a set given a key value.<br /></p>

<MarginText>96.12/3</MarginText>
<p>Equivalent to Reference_Preserving_Key (Container, Find (Container, Key)). <br /></p>

<MarginText>96.13/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<p>The nested package Stable provides a type Stable.Set that represents a <em>stable</em> set, which is one that cannot grow and shrink. Such a set can be created by calling the Copy function, or by establishing a <em>stabilized view</em> of an ordinary set.<br /></p>

<MarginText>96.14/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<p>The subprograms of the set package that have a parameter or result of type Set are included in the nested package Stable with the same specification, except that the following are omitted:<br /></p>

<MarginText>96.15/5</MarginText>
<p>Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited, Assign, Move, Insert, Include, Clear, Delete, Exclude, Replace, Replace_Element, procedures Union, Intersection, Difference, and Symmetric_Difference, (for Ordered_sets) Delete_First and Delete_Last, and (for Hashed_sets) Reserve_Capacity <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>96.a.1/5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>The Generic_Keys package is not included in the Stable package. The functions Union, Intersection, Difference, and Symmetric_Difference are included in the Stable package. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>96.a.2/5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>The names Set and Cursor mean the types declared in the nested package in these subprogram specifications. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>96.a.3/5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>The omitted routines are those that tamper with cursors (or test that state). The model is that it is impossible to tamper with cursors of a stable view since no such operations are included. Thus tampering checks are not needed for a stable view, and we omit the operations associated with those checks. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>96.16/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<p>The operations of this package are equivalent to those for ordinary sets, except that the calls to Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited that occur in preconditions are replaced by False, and any that occur in postconditions are replaced by True.<br /></p>

<MarginText>96.17/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0439-1"]} />
<p>If a stable set is declared with the Base discriminant designating a pre-existing ordinary set, the stable set represents a stabilized view of the underlying ordinary set, and any operation on the stable set is reflected on the underlying ordinary set. While a stabilized view exists, any operation that tampers with cursors performed on the underlying set is prohibited. The finalization of a stable set that provides such a view removes this restriction on the underlying ordinary set [(though some other restriction can exist due to other concurrent iterations or stabilized views)].<br /></p>

<MarginText>96.18/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0438-1"]} />
<p>If a stable set is declared without specifying Base, the object is necessarily initialized. The initializing expression of the stable set, [typically a call on Copy], determines the Length of the set. The Length of a stable set never changes after initialization.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>96.b/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0438-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="proof">
<strong></strong>Initialization is required as the type is indefinite, see <a href="../AA-3/AA-3.3#Subclause_3.3.1">3.3.1</a>. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Bounded (Run-Time) Errors

<MarginText>96.19/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0022-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p>It is a bounded error for the actual function associated with a generic formal subprogram, when called as part of an operation of a set package, to tamper with elements of any set parameter of the operation. Either Program_Error is raised, or the operation works as defined on the value of the set either prior to, or subsequent to, some or all of the modifications to the set.<br /></p>

<MarginText>96.20/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0027-1"]} />
<p>It is a bounded error to call any subprogram declared in the visible part of a set package when the associated container has been finalized. If the operation takes Container as an <strong>in out</strong> parameter, then it raises Constraint_Error or Program_Error. Otherwise, the operation either proceeds as it would for an empty container, or it raises Constraint_Error or Program_Error. <br /></p>


#### Erroneous Execution

<MarginText>97/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>A Cursor value is <em>invalid</em> if any of the following have occurred since it was created: <br /></p>

<MarginText>98/2</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The set that contains the element it designates has been finalized;<br /></li>
<MarginText>98.1/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1"]} />
<li>The set that contains the element it designates has been used as the Target of a call to Assign, or as the target of an <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code>;<br /></li>
<MarginText>99/2</MarginText>
<li>The set that contains the element it designates has been used as the Source or Target of a call to Move; or<br /></li>
<MarginText>100/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<li>The element it designates has been removed from the set that previously contained the element. <br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>100.a/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>This can happen directly via calls to Clear, Exclude, Delete, and Update_Element_Preserving_Key, and indirectly via calls to procedures Intersection, Difference, and Symmetric_Difference. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>101/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The result of "=" or Has_Element is unspecified if these functions are called with an invalid cursor parameter. Execution is erroneous if any other subprogram declared in Containers.Hashed_Sets or Containers.Ordered_Sets is called with an invalid cursor parameter.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>101.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>The list above is intended to be exhaustive. In other cases, a cursor value continues to designate its original element. For instance, cursor values survive the insertion and deletion of other elements.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>101.b/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
While it is possible to check for these cases, in many cases the overhead necessary to make the check is substantial in time or space. Implementations are encouraged to check for as many of these cases as possible and raise Program_Error if detected. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>101.1/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p>Execution is erroneous if the set associated with the result of a call to Reference or Constant_Reference is finalized before the result object returned by the call to Reference or Constant_Reference is finalized. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>101.c/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>Each object of Reference_Type and Constant_Reference_Type probably contains some reference to the originating container. If that container is prematurely finalized (which is only possible via Unchecked_Deallocation, as accessibility checks prevent passing a container to Reference that will not live as long as the result), the finalization of the object of Reference_Type will try to access a nonexistent object. This is a normal case of a dangling pointer created by Unchecked_Deallocation; we have to explicitly mention it here as the pointer in question is not visible in the specification of the type. (This is the same reason we have to say this for invalid cursors.) <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Implementation Requirements

<MarginText>102/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0437-1"]} />
<p>No storage associated with a set  object shall be lost upon assignment or scope exit.<br /></p>

<MarginText>103/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>The execution of an <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code> for a set shall have the effect of copying the elements from the source set object to the target set object and changing the length of the target object to that of the source object.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>103.a/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0298-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<strong></strong>An assignment of a Set is a &ldquo;deep&rdquo; copy; that is the elements are copied as well as the data structures. We say &ldquo;effect of&rdquo; in order to allow the implementation to avoid copying elements immediately if it wishes. For instance, an implementation that avoided copying until one of the containers is modified would be allowed. (Note that this implementation would require care, see <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a> for more.) <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Implementation Advice

<MarginText>104/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Move should not copy elements, and should minimize copying of internal data structures. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>104.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<strong></strong>Move for sets should not copy elements, and should minimize copying of internal data structures.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>104.b/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<strong></strong>Usually that can be accomplished simply by moving the pointer(s) to the internal data structures from the Source container to the Target container. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>105/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If an exception is propagated from a set operation, no storage should be lost, nor any elements removed from a set unless specified by the operation. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<strong></strong>If an exception is propagated from a set operation, no storage should be lost, nor any elements removed from a set unless specified by the operation.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.b/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>This is important so that programs can recover from errors. But we don't want to require heroic efforts, so we just require documentation of cases where this can't be accomplished. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Wording Changes from Ada 95

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.c/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
This description of sets is new; the extensions are documented with the specific packages. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.d/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Added reference support to make set containers more convenient to use. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Wording Changes from Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.e/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Added procedure Assign; the extension and incompatibility is documented with the specific packages.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.f/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Generalized the definition of Move. Specified which elements are read/written by stream attributes.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.g/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0022-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<strong></strong> Added a Bounded (Run-Time) Error to cover tampering by generic actual subprograms.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.h/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0027-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<strong></strong> Added a Bounded (Run-Time) Error to cover access to finalized set containers.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.i/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<strong></strong> Revised the definition of invalid cursors to cover missing (and new) cases.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.j/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0265-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<strong></strong> Defined when a container prohibits tampering in order to more clearly define where the check is made and the exception raised. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Inconsistencies With Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.k/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Procedures Union, Intersection, Difference, and Symmeteric_Difference are now defined to tamper with the cursors of the Target parameter. A program which attempts to use one of these operations while tampering is prohibited will raise Program_Error. However, since the operations do modify the container, the effects would have been unpredictable, so this change will likely fix bugs. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.l/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0196-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<strong></strong> Replace_Element is now defined such that it can be used concurrently so long as it operates on different elements. This allows some container operations to be used in parallel without separate synchronization. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Wording Changes from Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.m/4</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0110-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<strong>Corrigendum:</strong> Clarified that tampering checks precede all other checks made by a subprogram (but come after those associated with the call).<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.n/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Added contracts to this container. This includes describing some of the semantics with pre- and postconditions, rather than English text. Note that the preconditions can be Suppressed (see <a href="../AA-11/AA-11.5">11.5</a>). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<a id="Subclause_A.18.8"></a>

## A.18.8  The Generic Package Containers.Hashed_Sets


#### Static Semantics

<MarginText>1/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The generic library package Containers.Hashed_Sets has the following declaration: <br /></p>

<MarginText>2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0084-1", "AI05-0212-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
with Ada.Iterator_Interfaces;{"\n"}generic{"\n"}   type Element_Type is private;{"\n"}   with function Hash (Element : Element_Type) return Hash_Type;{"\n"}   with function Equivalent_Elements (Left, Right : Element_Type){"\n"}                 return Boolean;{"\n"}   with function "=" (Left, Right : Element_Type) return Boolean is {"<"}{">"};{"\n"}package Ada.Containers.Hashed_Sets {"\n"}   with Preelaborate, Remote_Types,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in out synchronized is {"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>2.a/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>For discussion on the reasons and meaning of the specifications of the Global and Nonblocking aspects in this generic package, see the notes on the equivalent operations in the specification of the Containers.Vectors package (see <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a>). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>3/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0212-1", "AI12-0339-1", "AI12-0399-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
   type Set is tagged private{"\n"}      with Constant_Indexing ={">"} Constant_Reference,{"\n"}           Default_Iterator  ={">"} Iterate,{"\n"}           Iterator_Element  ={">"} Element_Type,{"\n"}           Iterator_View     ={">"} Stable.Set,{"\n"}           Aggregate         ={">"} (Empty       ={">"} Empty,{"\n"}                                 Add_Unnamed ={">"} Include),{"\n"}           Stable_Properties ={">"} (Length,{"\n"}                                 Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited),{"\n"}           Default_Initial_Condition ={">"}{"\n"}              Length (Set) = 0 and then{"\n"}              (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Set)), {"\n"}            Preelaborable_Initialization ;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>3.a/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>Unlike a Vector, the Stable_Properties of a Hashed_Set do not include the Capacity. If we had included it, some of the otherwise shared definitions would need different postconditions for Hashed_Sets and Ordered_Sets. If we were starting these containers from scratch, we probably would have approached the sharing of definitions differently so that we could avoid issues like this, but a major reorganization of this existing material would be too much change. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>
