<MarginText>63/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>An object of type Set contains an expandable hash table, which is used to provide direct access to elements. The <em>capacity</em> of an object of type Set is the maximum number of elements that can be inserted into the hash table prior to it being automatically expanded.<br /></p>

<MarginText>64/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Two elements <em>E1</em> and <em>E2</em> are defined to be <em>equivalent</em> if Equivalent_Elements (<em>E1</em>, <em>E2</em>) returns True.<br /></p>

<MarginText>65/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The actual function for the generic formal function Hash is expected to return the same value each time it is called with a particular element value. For any two equivalent elements, the actual for Hash is expected to return the same value. If the actual for Hash behaves in some other manner, the behavior of this package is unspecified. Which subprograms of this package call Hash, and how many times they call it, is unspecified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>66/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The actual function for the generic formal function Equivalent_Elements is expected to return the same value each time it is called with a particular pair of Element values. It should define an equivalence relationship, that is, be reflexive, symmetric, and transitive. If the actual for Equivalent_Elements behaves in some other manner, the behavior of this package is unspecified. Which subprograms of this package call Equivalent_Elements, and how many times they call it, is unspecified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>66.1/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0044-1"]} />
<p>If the actual function for the generic formal function "=" returns True for any pair of nonequivalent elements, then the behavior of the container function "=" is unspecified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>67/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If the value of an element stored in a set is changed other than by an operation in this package such that at least one of Hash or Equivalent_Elements give different results, the behavior of this package is unspecified.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>67.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>See <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.5">A.18.5</a>, &ldquo;<a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.5">The Generic Package Containers.Hashed_Maps</a>&rdquo; for a suggested implementation, and for justification of the restrictions regarding Hash and Equivalent_Elements. Note that sets only need to store elements, not key/element pairs. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>68/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Which elements are the first element and the last element of a set, and which element is the successor of a given element, are unspecified, other than the general semantics described in <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.7">A.18.7</a>.<br /></p>

<MarginText>68.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Empty (Capacity : Count_Type := implementation-defined){"\n"}   return Set{"\n"}   with Post ={">"}{"\n"}           Capacity (Empty'Result) {">"}= Capacity and then{"\n"}           not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Empty'Result) and then{"\n"}           Length (Empty'Result) = 0;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>68.2/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0339-1"]} />
<p>Returns an empty set.<br /></p>

<MarginText>69/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Capacity (Container : Set) return Count_Type{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>70/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Returns the capacity of Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>71/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Reserve_Capacity (Container : in out Set;{"\n"}                            Capacity  : in     Count_Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Container.Capacity {">"}= Capacity;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>72/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Reserve_Capacity allocates a new hash table such that the length of the resulting set can become at least the value Capacity without requiring an additional call to Reserve_Capacity, and is large enough to hold the current length of Container. Reserve_Capacity then rehashes the elements in Container onto the new hash table. It replaces the old hash table with the new hash table, and then deallocates the old hash table. Any exception raised during allocation is propagated and Container is not modified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>73/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p><em>This paragraph was deleted.</em> <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>73.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>Reserve_Capacity tampers with the cursors, as rehashing probably will change the relationships of the elements in Container. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>74/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Clear (Container : in out Set){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Capacity (Container) = Capacity (Container)'Old and then{"\n"}                Length (Container) = 0;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>75/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>In addition to the semantics described in <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.7">A.18.7</a>, Clear does not affect the capacity of Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>75.1/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Assign (Target : in out Set; Source : in Set){"\n"}      with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                      or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}           Post ={">"} Length (Source) = Length (Target) and then{"\n"}                   Capacity (Target) {">"}= Length (Source);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>75.2/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p>In addition to the semantics described in <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.7">A.18.7</a>, if the length of Source is greater than the capacity of Target, Reserve_Capacity (Target, Length (Source)) is called before assigning any elements.<br /></p>

<MarginText>75.3/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Copy (Source : Set; Capacity : Count_Type := 0){"\n"}   return Set{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Capacity = 0 or else Capacity {">"}= Length (Source){"\n"}                   or else raise Capacity_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"}{"\n"}           Length (Copy'Result) = Length (Source) and then{"\n"}           not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Copy'Result) and then{"\n"}           Copy'Result.Capacity = (if Capacity = 0 then{"\n"}              Length (Source) else Capacity);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>75.4/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Returns a set whose elements are initialized from the elements of Source. <br /></p>

<MarginText>76/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert (Container : in out Set;{"\n"}                  New_Item  : in     Element_Type;{"\n"}                  Position  :    out Cursor;{"\n"}                  Inserted  :    out Boolean){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Count_Type'Last - 1{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (declare{"\n"}                   Original_Length : constant Count_Type :={"\n"}                      Length (Container)'Old;{"\n"}                 begin{"\n"}                   Has_Element (Container, Position) and then{"\n"}                  (if Inserted then{"\n"}                     Length (Container) = Original_Length + 1{"\n"}                   else{"\n"}                     Length (Container) = Original_Length)) and then{"\n"}                 Capacity (Container) {">"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>77/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>In addition to the semantics described in <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.7">A.18.7</a>, if Length (Container) equals Capacity (Container), then Insert first calls Reserve_Capacity to increase the capacity of Container to some larger value.<br /></p>

<MarginText>78/2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function First (Container : Set) return Cursor;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>79/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If Length (Container) = 0, then First returns No_Element. Otherwise, First returns a cursor that designates the first hashed element in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>80/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Equivalent_Elements (Left, Right : Cursor){"\n"}   return Boolean{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} (Left /= No_Element and then Right /= No_Element){"\n"}                     or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>81/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Equivalent_Elements (Element (Left), Element (Right)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>82/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Equivalent_Elements (Left  : Cursor;{"\n"}                              Right : Element_Type) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} Left /= No_Element or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>83/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Equivalent_Elements (Element (Left), Right).<br /></p>

<MarginText>84/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Equivalent_Elements (Left  : Element_Type;{"\n"}                              Right : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} Right /= No_Element or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>85/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Equivalent_Elements (Left, Element (Right)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>85.1/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0266-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Iterate (Container : in Set){"\n"}   return Set_Iterator_Interfaces.Parallel_Iterator 'Class{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>85.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0266-1"]} />
<p>Iterate returns an iterator object (see <a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.1">5.5.1</a>) that will generate a value for a loop parameter (see <a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.2">5.5.2</a>) designating each element in Container, starting with the first element and moving the cursor according to the successor relation when used as a forward iterator, and processing all nodes concurrently when used as a parallel iterator. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited while the iterator object exists (in particular, in the <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.1#S0166">sequence_of_statements</a></code> of the <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#S0178">loop_statement</a></code> whose <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#S0183">iterator_specification</a></code> denotes this object). The iterator object needs finalization.<br /></p>

<MarginText>86/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>For any element <em>E</em>, the actual function for the generic formal function Generic_Keys.Hash is expected to be such that Hash (<em>E</em>) = Generic_Keys.Hash (Key (<em>E</em>)). If the actuals for Key or Generic_Keys.Hash behave in some other manner, the behavior of Generic_Keys is unspecified. Which subprograms of Generic_Keys call Generic_Keys.Hash, and how many times they call it, is unspecified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>87/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>For any two elements <em>E1</em> and <em>E2</em>, the boolean values Equivalent_Elements (<em>E1</em>, <em>E2</em>) and Equivalent_Keys (Key (<em>E1</em>), Key (<em>E2</em>)) are expected to be equal. If the actuals for Key or Equivalent_Keys behave in some other manner, the behavior of Generic_Keys is unspecified. Which subprograms of Generic_Keys call Equivalent_Keys, and how many times they call it, is unspecified.<br /></p>


#### Implementation Advice

<MarginText>88/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If <em>N</em> is the length of a set, the average time complexity of the subprograms Insert, Include, Replace, Delete, Exclude, and Find that take an element parameter should be <em>O</em>(log <em>N</em>). The average time complexity of the subprograms that take a cursor parameter should be <em>O</em>(1). The average time complexity of Reserve_Capacity should be <em>O</em>(<em>N</em>). <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>88.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<strong></strong>The average time complexity of the Insert, Include, Replace, Delete, Exclude, and Find operations of Containers.Hashed_Sets that take an element parameter should be <em>O</em>(log <em>N</em>). The average time complexity of the subprograms of Containers.Hashed_Sets that take a cursor parameter should be <em>O</em>(1). The average time complexity of Containers.Hashed_Sets.Reserve_Capacity should be <em>O</em>(<em>N</em>).<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>88.b/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<strong></strong>See <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.5">A.18.5</a>, &ldquo;<a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.5">The Generic Package Containers.Hashed_Maps</a>&rdquo; for implementation notes regarding some of the operations of this package. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 95

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>88.c/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The generic package Containers.Hashed_Sets is new. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Incompatibilities With Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>88.d/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Subprograms Assign and Copy are added to Containers.Hashed_Sets. If an instance of Containers.Hashed_Sets is referenced in a <code><a href="../AA-8/AA-8.4#S0235">use_clause</a></code>, and an entity <em>E</em> with the same <code><a href="../AA-3/AA-3.1#S0022">defining_identifier</a></code> as a new entity in Containers.Hashed_Sets is defined in a package that is also referenced in a <code><a href="../AA-8/AA-8.4#S0235">use_clause</a></code>, the entity <em>E</em> may no longer be use-visible, resulting in errors. This should be rare and is easily fixed if it does occur. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>88.e/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Added iterator and indexing support to make hashed set containers more convenient to use. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Wording Changes from Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>88.f/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0044-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<strong></strong> Added wording to require the formal function be such that equal elements are also equivalent.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>88.g/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0084-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<strong></strong> Added a pragma Remote_Types so that containers can be used in distributed programs. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Incompatibilities With Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>88.h/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0339-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
A number of new subprograms, types, and even a nested package were added to Containers.Hashed_Sets to better support contracts and stable views. Therefore, a use clause conflict is possible; see the introduction of <a href="../AA-A/">Annex A</a> for more on this topic. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>88.i/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0212-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Sets now support positional container aggregates, so <code><a href="../AA-4/AA-4.3#S0106">aggregate</a></code> syntax can be used to create Sets.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>88.j/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0266-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The iterator for the container now can return a parallel iterator which can be used to process the container in parallel. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Wording Changes from Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>88.k/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Added contracts to this container. This includes describing some of the semantics with pre- and postconditions, rather than English text. Note that the preconditions can be Suppressed (see <a href="../AA-11/AA-11.5">11.5</a>). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<a id="Subclause_A.18.9"></a>

<MarginText>78/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Two elements <em>E1</em> and <em>E2</em> are <em>equivalent</em> if both <em>E1</em> {"<"} <em>E2</em> and <em>E2</em> {"<"} <em>E1</em> return False, using the generic formal "{"<"}" operator for elements. Function Equivalent_Elements returns True if Left and Right are equivalent, and False otherwise.<br /></p>

<MarginText>79/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0044-1"]} />
<p>The actual function for the generic formal function "{"<"}" on Element_Type values is expected to return the same value each time it is called with a particular pair of key values. It should define a strict weak ordering relationship (see <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18">A.18</a>). If the actual for "{"<"}" behaves in some other manner, the behavior of this package is unspecified. Which subprograms of this package call "{"<"}" and how many times they call it, is unspecified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>79.1/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0044-1"]} />
<p>If the actual function for the generic formal function "=" returns True for any pair of nonequivalent elements, then the behavior of the container function "=" is unspecified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>80/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If the value of an element stored in a set is changed other than by an operation in this package such that at least one of "{"<"}" or "=" give different results, the behavior of this package is unspecified.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>80.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>See <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.6">A.18.6</a>, &ldquo;<a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.6">The Generic Package Containers.Ordered_Maps</a>&rdquo; for a suggested implementation, and for justification of the restrictions regarding "{"<"}" and "=". Note that sets only need to store elements, not key/element pairs. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>81/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>The <em>first element</em> of a nonempty set is the one which is less than all the other elements in the set. The <em>last element</em> of a nonempty set is the one which is greater than all the other elements in the set. The <em>successor</em> of an element is the smallest element that is larger than the given element. The <em>predecessor</em> of an element is the largest element that is smaller than the given element. All comparisons are done using the generic formal "{"<"}" operator for elements.<br /></p>

<MarginText>81.1/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Copy (Source : Set) return Set{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} Length (Copy'Result) = Length (Source) and then{"\n"}                not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Copy'Result);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>81.2/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<p>Returns a set whose elements are initialized from the corresponding elements of Source.<br /></p>

<MarginText>82/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Delete_First (Container : in out Set){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (declare{"\n"}                   Original_Length : constant Count_Type :={"\n"}                      Length (Container)'Old;{"\n"}                 begin{"\n"}                   (if Original_Length = 0 then Length (Container) = 0{"\n"}                    else Length (Container) = Original_Length - 1));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>83/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p>If Container is empty, Delete_First has no effect. Otherwise, the element designated by First (Container) is removed from Container. Delete_First tampers with the cursors of Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>84/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Delete_Last (Container : in out Set){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (declare{"\n"}                   Original_Length : constant Count_Type :={"\n"}                      Length (Container)'Old;{"\n"}                 begin{"\n"}                   (if Original_Length = 0 then Length (Container) = 0{"\n"}                    else Length (Container) = Original_Length - 1));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>85/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p>If Container is empty, Delete_Last has no effect. Otherwise, the element designated by Last (Container) is removed from Container. Delete_Last tampers with the cursors of Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>86/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function First_Element (Container : Set) return Element_Type{"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} (not Is_Empty (Container) {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>87/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Element (First (Container)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>88/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Last (Container : Set) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if not Is_Empty (Container) then {"\n"}                    Has_Element (Container, Last'Result){"\n"}                 else Last'Result = No_Element);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>89/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Returns a cursor that designates the last element in Container. If Container is empty, returns No_Element.<br /></p>

<MarginText>90/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Last_Element (Container : Set) return Element_Type{"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} (not Is_Empty (Container) {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>91/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Element (Last (Container)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>92/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Previous (Position : Cursor) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position = No_Element then{"\n"}                   Previous'Result = No_Element);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>93/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>If Position equals No_Element, then Previous returns No_Element. Otherwise, Previous returns a cursor designating the predecessor element of the one designated by Position. If Position designates the first element, then Previous returns No_Element.<br /></p>

<MarginText>93.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Previous (Container : Set;{"\n"}                   Position : Cursor) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position = No_Element or else{"\n"}                Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position = No_Element then{"\n"}                   Previous'Result = No_Element{"\n"}                 elsif Previous'Result = No_Element then{"\n"}                   Position = First (Container){"\n"}                 else Has_Element (Container, Previous'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>93.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Returns a cursor designating the predecessor of the node designated by Position in Container, if any.<br /></p>

<MarginText>94/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Previous (Position : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>95/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Position := Previous (Position).<br /></p>

<MarginText>95.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Previous (Container : in     Set;{"\n"}                    Position  : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position = No_Element or else{"\n"}                Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                 then Has_Element (Container, Position));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>95.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Position := Previous (Container, Position).<br /></p>

<MarginText>96/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Floor (Container : Set;{"\n"}                Item      : Element_Type) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} (if Floor'Result /= No_Element{"\n"}                 then Has_Element (Container, Floor'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>97/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p>Floor searches for the last element which is not greater than Item. If such an element is found, a cursor that designates it is returned. Otherwise, No_Element is returned.<br /></p>

<MarginText>98/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Ceiling (Container : Set;{"\n"}                  Item      : Element_Type) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} (if Ceiling'Result /= No_Element{"\n"}                 then Has_Element (Container, Ceiling'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>99/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p>Ceiling searches for the first element which is not less than Item. If such an element is found, a cursor that designates it is returned. Otherwise, No_Element is returned.<br /></p>

<MarginText>100/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function "{"<"}" (Left, Right : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} (Left /= No_Element and then Right /= No_Element){"\n"}                      or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>101/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Element (Left) {"<"} Element (Right).<br /></p>

<MarginText>102/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function "{">"}" (Left, Right : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} (Left /= No_Element and then Right /= No_Element){"\n"}                      or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>103/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Element (Right) {"<"} Element (Left).<br /></p>

<MarginText>104/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function "{"<"}" (Left : Cursor; Right : Element_Type) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} Left /= No_Element or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>105/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Element (Left) {"<"} Right.<br /></p>

<MarginText>106/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function "{">"}" (Left : Cursor; Right : Element_Type) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} Left /= No_Element or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}           Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>107/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Right {"<"} Element (Left).<br /></p>

<MarginText>108/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function "{"<"}" (Left : Element_Type; Right : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} Right /= No_Element or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}           Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>109/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Left {"<"} Element (Right).<br /></p>

<MarginText>110/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function "{">"}" (Left : Element_Type; Right : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} Right /= No_Element or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}           Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>111/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Element (Right) {"<"} Left.<br /></p>

<MarginText>112/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Reverse_Iterate{"\n"}  (Container : in Set;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Position : in Cursor)){"\n"}   with Allows_Exit;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>113/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p>Iterates over the elements in Container as per procedure Iterate, with the difference that the elements are traversed in predecessor order, starting with the last element.<br /></p>

<MarginText>113.1/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0266-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Iterate (Container : in Set){"\n"}   return Set_Iterator_Interfaces.Parallel_Reversible_Iterator 'Class{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>113.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0266-1"]} />
<p>Iterate returns an  iterator object (see <a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.1">5.5.1</a>) that will generate a value for a loop parameter (see <a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.2">5.5.2</a>) designating each element in Container, starting with the first element and moving the cursor according to the successor relation when used as a forward iterator, and starting with the last element and moving the cursor according to the predecessor relation when used as a reverse iterator, and processing all nodes concurrently when used as a parallel iterator. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited while the iterator object exists (in particular, in the <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.1#S0166">sequence_of_statements</a></code> of the <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#S0178">loop_statement</a></code> whose <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#S0183">iterator_specification</a></code> denotes this object). The iterator object needs finalization.<br /></p>

<MarginText>113.3/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Iterate (Container : in Set; Start : in Cursor){"\n"}   return Set_Iterator_Interfaces.Reversible_Iterator'Class{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Start /= No_Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Start){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>113.4/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0262-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Iterate returns a reversible iterator object (see <a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.1">5.5.1</a>) that will generate a value for a loop parameter (see <a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.2">5.5.2</a>) designating each element in Container, starting with the element designated by Start and moving the cursor according to the successor relation when used as a forward iterator, or moving the cursor according to the predecessor relation when used as a reverse iterator. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited while the iterator object exists (in particular, in the <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.1#S0166">sequence_of_statements</a></code> of the <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#S0178">loop_statement</a></code> whose <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#S0183">iterator_specification</a></code> denotes this object). The iterator object needs finalization.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>113.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>Exits are allowed from the loops created using the iterator objects. In particular, to stop the iteration at a particular cursor, just add <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>113.b/3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
exit when Cur = Stop;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>113.c/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
in the body of the loop (assuming that Cur is the loop parameter and Stop is the cursor that you want to stop at). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>114/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>For any two elements <em>E1</em> and <em>E2</em>, the boolean values (<em>E1</em> {"<"} <em>E2</em>) and (Key(<em>E1</em>) {"<"} Key(<em>E2</em>)) are expected to be equal. If the actuals for Key or Generic_Keys."{"<"}" behave in some other manner, the behavior of this package is unspecified. Which subprograms of this package call Key and Generic_Keys."{"<"}", and how many times the functions are called, is unspecified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>115/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>In addition to the semantics described in <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.7">A.18.7</a>, the subprograms in package Generic_Keys named Floor and Ceiling, are equivalent to the corresponding subprograms in the parent package, with the difference that the Key subprogram parameter is compared to elements in the container using the Key and "{"<"}" generic formal functions. The function named Equivalent_Keys in package Generic_Keys returns True if both Left {"<"} Right and Right {"<"} Left return False using the generic formal "{"<"}" operator, and returns True otherwise.<br /></p>


#### Implementation Advice

<MarginText>116/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If <em>N</em> is the length of a set, then the worst-case time complexity of the Insert, Include, Replace, Delete, Exclude, and Find operations that take an element parameter should be <em>O</em>((log <em>N</em>)**2) or better. The worst-case time complexity of the subprograms that take a cursor parameter should be <em>O</em>(1). <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>116.a/2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<strong></strong>The worst-case time complexity of the Insert, Include, Replace, Delete, Exclude, and Find operations of Containers.Ordered_Sets that take an element parameter should be <em>O</em>((log <em>N</em>)**2). The worst-case time complexity of the subprograms of Containers.Ordered_Sets that take a cursor parameter should be <em>O</em>(1).<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>116.b/2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<strong></strong>See <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.6">A.18.6</a>, &ldquo;<a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.6">The Generic Package Containers.Ordered_Maps</a>&rdquo; for implementation notes regarding some of the operations of this package. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

<a id="Subclause_A.18.10"></a>

## A.18.10  The Generic Package Containers.Multiway_Trees

<MarginText>1/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>The language-defined generic package Containers.Multiway_Trees provides private types Tree and Cursor, and a set of operations for each type. A multiway tree container is well-suited to represent nested structures.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>1.a/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>This tree just provides a basic structure, and make no promises about balancing or other automatic organization. In this sense, it is different than the indexed (Map, Set) forms. Rather, it provides a building block on which to construct more complex and more specialized tree containers. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>2/4</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI12-0078-1", "AI12-0159-1"]} />
<p>A multiway tree container object manages a tree of <em>nodes</em>, consisting of a <em>root node</em> and a set of <em>internal nodes</em>; each internal node contains an element and pointers to the parent, first child, last child, next (successor) sibling, and previous (predecessor) sibling internal nodes. A cursor designates a particular node within a tree (and by extension the element contained in that node, if any). A cursor keeps designating the same node (and element) as long as the node is part of the container, even if the node is moved within the container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>3/4</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0078-1"]} />
<p>A <em>subtree</em> is a particular node (which <em>roots the subtree</em>) and all of its child nodes (including all of the children of the child nodes, recursively). The root node is always present and has neither an associated element value nor any parent node; it has pointers to its first child and its last child, if any. The root node provides a place to add nodes to an otherwise empty tree and represents the base of the tree.<br /></p>

<MarginText>4/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>A node that has no children is called a <em>leaf node</em>. The <em>ancestors</em> of a node are the node itself, its parent node, the parent of the parent node, and so on until a node with no parent is reached. Similarly, the <em>descendants</em> of a node are the node itself, its child nodes, the children of each child node, and so on.<br /></p>

<MarginText>5/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>The nodes of a subtree can be visited in several different orders. For a <em>depth-first order</em>, after visiting a node, the nodes of its child list are each visited in depth-first order, with each child node visited in natural order (first child to last child).<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>5.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>For the depth-first order, when each child node is visited, the child list of the child node is visited before the next sibling of the child node is visited. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Static Semantics

<MarginText>6/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>The generic library package Containers.Multiway_Trees has the following declaration: <br /></p>

<MarginText>7/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0212-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
with Ada.Iterator_Interfaces;{"\n"}generic{"\n"}   type Element_Type is private;{"\n"}   with function "=" (Left, Right : Element_Type) return Boolean is {"<"}{">"};{"\n"}package Ada.Containers.Multiway_Trees {"\n"}   with Preelaborate, Remote_Types,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in out synchronized is {"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>7.a/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>For discussion on the reasons and meaning of the specifications of the Global and Nonblocking aspects in this generic package, see the notes on the equivalent operations in the specification of the Containers.Vectors package (see <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a>). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>8/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0212-1", "AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0399-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
   type Tree is tagged private{"\n"}      with Constant_Indexing ={">"} Constant_Reference,{"\n"}           Variable_Indexing ={">"} Reference,{"\n"}           Default_Iterator  ={">"} Iterate,{"\n"}           Iterator_Element  ={">"} Element_Type,{"\n"}           Iterator_View     ={">"} Stable.Tree,{"\n"}           Stable_Properties ={">"} (Node_Count,{"\n"}                                 Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited,{"\n"}                                 Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited),{"\n"}           Default_Initial_Condition ={">"}{"\n"}              Node_Count (Tree) = 1 and then{"\n"}              (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Tree)) and then{"\n"}              (not Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited (Tree)), {"\n"}            Preelaborable_Initialization ;{"\n"}
<MarginText>9/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0399-1"]} />
   type Cursor is private {"\n"}      with  Preelaborable_Initialization ;{"\n"}
<MarginText>10/3</MarginText>
   Empty_Tree : constant Tree;{"\n"}
<MarginText>11/3</MarginText>
   No_Element : constant Cursor;{"\n"}
<MarginText>11.1/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
   function Equal_Element (Left, Right : Element_Type){"\n"}      return Boolean renames "=";{"\n"}
<MarginText>12/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
   function Has_Element (Position : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}      with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}
<MarginText>12.1/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
   function Has_Element (Container : Tree; Position : Cursor){"\n"}      return Boolean{"\n"}      with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}
<MarginText>13/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
   package Tree_Iterator_Interfaces is new{"\n"}      Ada.Iterator_Interfaces (Cursor, Has_Element);{"\n"}
<MarginText>14/3</MarginText>
   function Equal_Subtree (Left_Position : Cursor;{"\n"}                           Right_Position: Cursor) return Boolean;{"\n"}
<MarginText>15/3</MarginText>
   function "=" (Left, Right : Tree) return Boolean;{"\n"}
<MarginText>15.1/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
   function Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited{"\n"}      (Container : Tree) return Boolean{"\n"}      with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}
<MarginText>15.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
   function Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited{"\n"}      (Container : Tree) return Boolean{"\n"}      with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>22.a/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>When this function is true, the Position can be meaningfully used with operations for Container. We define this because many operations allow the root (which does not have an element, so Has_Element returns False), so many preconditions get unwieldy. We allow No_Element as it is allowed by many queries, and for existing routines, it raises a different exception (Constraint_Error rather than Program_Error) than a cursor for the wrong container does. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<p>The actual function for the generic formal function "=" on Element_Type values is expected to define a reflexive and symmetric relationship and return the same result value each time it is called with a particular pair of values. If it behaves in some other manner, the functions Find, Reverse_Find, Equal_Subtree, and "=" on tree values return an unspecified value. The exact arguments and number of calls of this generic formal function by the functions Find, Reverse_Find, Equal_Subtree, and "=" on tree values are unspecified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>73/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>The type Tree is used to represent trees. The type Tree needs finalization (see <a href="../AA-7/AA-7.6">7.6</a>).<br /></p>

<MarginText>74/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p>Empty_Tree represents the empty Tree object. It contains only the root node (Node_Count (Empty_Tree) returns 1). If an object of type Tree is not otherwise initialized, it is initialized to the same value as Empty_Tree.<br /></p>

<MarginText>75/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>No_Element represents a cursor that designates no element. If an object of type Cursor is not otherwise initialized, it is initialized to the same value as No_Element.<br /></p>

<MarginText>76/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI12-0434-1"]} />
<p>The primitive  "=" operator for type Cursor returns True if both cursors are No_Element, or designate the same element in the same container.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>76.a/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0434-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<strong>To be honest: </strong>&ldquo;The primitive "=" operator&rdquo; is the one with two parameters of type Cursor which returns Boolean. We're not talking about some other (hidden) primitive function named "=". <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>77/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>Execution of the default implementation of the Input, Output, Read, or Write attribute of type Cursor raises Program_Error.<br /></p>

<MarginText>78/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI12-0437-1"]} />
<p>Tree'Write for a Tree object <em>T</em> writes Node_Count(<em>T</em>) - 1 elements of the tree to the stream. It may also  write additional information about the tree.<br /></p>

<MarginText>79/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>Tree'Read reads the representation of a tree from the stream, and assigns to <em>Item</em> a tree with the same elements and structure as was written by Tree'Write.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>79.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>Streaming more elements than the container holds is wrong. For implementation implications of this rule, see the Implementation Note in <a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a>. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>80/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>[Some operations  check for &ldquo;tampering with cursors&rdquo; of a container because they depend on the set of elements of the container remaining constant, and others check for &ldquo;tampering with elements&rdquo; of a container because they depend on elements of the container not being replaced.] When tampering with cursors is <em>prohibited</em> for a particular tree object <em>T</em>, Program_Error is propagated by the finalization of <em>T</em>[, as well as by a call that passes <em>T</em> to certain of the operations of this package, as indicated by the precondition of such an operation]. Similarly, when tampering with elements is <em>prohibited</em> for <em>T</em>, Program_Error is propagated by a call that passes <em>T</em> to certain of the other operations of this package, as indicated by the precondition of such an operation.<br /></p>

<p><em>Paragraphs 81 through 90 are removed as preconditions now describe these rules.</em> <br /></p>

<MarginText>91/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Has_Element (Position : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>92/3</MarginText>
<p>Returns True if Position designates an element, and returns False otherwise. [In particular, Has_Element returns False if the cursor designates a root node or equals No_Element.]<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>92.a/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0005-1", "AI05-0136-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<strong>To be honest: </strong>This function might not detect cursors that designate deleted elements; such cursors are invalid (see below) and the result of calling Has_Element with an invalid cursor is unspecified (but not erroneous). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>92.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Has_Element (Container : Tree; Position : Cursor){"\n"}   return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>92.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Returns True if Position designates an element in Container, and returns False otherwise. [In particular, Has_Element returns False if the cursor designates a root node or equals No_Element.]<br /></p>

<MarginText>93/3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Equal_Subtree (Left_Position : Cursor;{"\n"}                        Right_Position: Cursor) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>94/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p>If Left_Position or Right_Position equals No_Element, propagates Constraint_Error. If the number of child nodes of the element designated by Left_Position is different from the number of child nodes of the element designated by Right_Position, the function returns False. If Left_Position designates a root node and Right_Position does not, the function returns False. If Right_Position designates a root node and Left_Position does not, the function returns False. Unless both cursors designate a root node, the elements are compared using the generic formal equality operator. If the result of the element comparison is False, the function returns False. Otherwise, it calls Equal_Subtree on a cursor designating each child element of the element designated by Left_Position and a cursor designating the corresponding child element of the element designated by Right_Position. If any such call returns False, the function returns False; otherwise, it returns True. Any exception raised during the evaluation of element equality is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>94.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>Left_Position and Right_Position do not need to be from the same tree. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>94.b/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<strong></strong>This wording describes the canonical semantics. However, the order and number of calls on the formal equality function is unspecified for all of the operations that use it in this package, so an implementation can call it as many or as few times as it needs to get the correct answer. Similarly, a global rule (see the introduction of <a href="../AA-A/">Annex A</a>) says that language-defined routines are not affected by overriding of other language-defined routines. This means that no reasonable program can tell how many times Equal_Subtree is called, and thus an implementation can call it as many or as few times as it needs to get the correct answer. Specifically, there is no requirement to call the formal equality or Equal_Subtree additional times once the answer has been determined. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>95/3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function "=" (Left, Right : Tree) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>96/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>If Left and Right denote the same tree object, then the function returns True. Otherwise, it calls Equal_Subtree with cursors designating the root nodes of Left and Right; the result is returned. Any exception raised during the evaluation of Equal_Subtree is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>96.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<strong></strong>Similar considerations apply here as apply to Equal_Subtree. The actual number of calls performed is unspecified. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>96.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited{"\n"}   (Container : Tree) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>96.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Returns True if tampering with cursors or tampering with elements is currently prohibited for Container, and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>96.b/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>Prohibiting tampering with elements also needs to prohibit tampering with cursors, as deleting an element is similar to replacing it. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>96.c/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<strong></strong>Various contracts elsewhere in this specification require that this function be implemented with synchronized data. Moreover, it is possible for tampering to be prohibited by multiple operations (sequentially or in parallel). Therefore, tampering needs to be implemented with an atomic or protected counter. The counter is initialized to zero, and is incremented when tampering is prohibited, and decremented when leaving an area that prohibited tampering. Function Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited returns True if the counter is nonzero. (Note that any case where the result is not well-defined for one task is incorrect use of shared variables and would be erroneous by the rules of <a href="../AA-9/AA-9.10">9.10</a>, so no special protection is needed to read the counter.) <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>96.3/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited{"\n"}   (Container : Tree) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>96.4/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Always returns False[, regardless of whether tampering with elements is prohibited].<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>96.d/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>A definite element cannot change size, so we allow operations that tamper with elements even when tampering with elements is prohibited. That's not true for the indefinite containers, which is why this kind of tampering exists. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>96.5/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Is_Empty (Container : Tree) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Is_Empty'Result = (Node_Count (Container) = 1);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>96.6/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Returns True if Container is empty.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>96.e/5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>An empty tree contains just the root node. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>97/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Node_Count (Container : Tree) return Count_Type{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>98/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>Node_Count returns the number of nodes in Container.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>98.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>Since all tree objects have a root node, this can never return a value of 0. Node_Count (Some_Tree) should always equal Subtree_Node_Count (Root (Some_Tree)). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>99/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Subtree_Node_Count (Position : Cursor) return Count_Type{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>100/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p>If Position is No_Element, Subtree_Node_Count returns 0; otherwise, Subtree_Node_Count returns the number of nodes in the subtree that is rooted by Position.<br /></p>

<MarginText>101/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Subtree_Node_Count  (Container : Tree; Position : Cursor){"\n"}    return Count_Type{"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} Meaningful_For (Container, Position) {"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null ;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>102/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>If Position is No_Element, Subtree_Node_Count returns 0; otherwise, Subtree_Node_Count returns the number of nodes in the subtree of Container that is rooted by Position .<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>102.a/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<em>This paragraph was deleted.</em><strong></strong> <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>102.b/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>We raise Program_Error if Position belongs to some other container because we have promised to read only the container passed to this function. Determining the answer requires reading the container that Position belongs to, which we've promised not to do if it is not Container. We don't make this check for functions like Has_Element and Is_Root which do not require reading another container to determine the answer, but we do make it for most functions. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>103/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Depth (Position : Cursor) return Count_Type{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>104/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p>If Position equals No_Element, Depth returns 0; otherwise, Depth returns the number of ancestor nodes of the node designated by Position (including the node itself).<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>104.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>Depth (Root (Some_Tree)) = 1. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>104.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Depth (Container : Tree; Position : Cursor){"\n"}   return Count_Type{"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} Meaningful_For (Container, Position) {"\n"}                  or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>104.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>If Position equals No_Element, Depth returns 0; otherwise, Depth returns the number of ancestor nodes of the node of Container designated by Position (including the node itself).<br /></p>

<MarginText>105/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Is_Root (Position : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>106/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p>Is_Root returns True if the Position designates the root node of some tree; and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<MarginText>106.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Is_Root (Container : Tree; Position : Cursor){"\n"}   return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>106.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Is_Root returns True if the Position designates the root node of Container; and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>106.a/5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>The two parameter Is_Root returns False even if Position is the root of some other tree than Container. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>107/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Is_Leaf (Position : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>108/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>Is_Leaf returns True if Position designates a node that does not have any child nodes; and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>108.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>Is_Leaf returns False if passed No_Element, since No_Element does not designate a node. Is_Leaf can be passed a cursor that designates the root node; Is_Leaf will return True if passed the root node of an empty tree. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>108.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Is_Leaf (Container : Tree; Position : Cursor){"\n"}   return Boolean{"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} Meaningful_For (Container, Position) {"\n"}                  or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>108.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Is_Leaf returns True if Position designates a node in Container that does not have any child nodes; and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<MarginText>108.3/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Is_Ancestor_Of (Container : Tree;{"\n"}                         Parent   : Cursor;{"\n"}                         Position : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} (Meaningful_For (Container, Position){"\n"}                  or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}               (Meaningful_For (Container, Parent){"\n"}                  or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>108.4/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Is_Ancestor_Of returns True if Parent designates an ancestor node of Position (including Position itself), and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<MarginText>109/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Root (Container : Tree) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Root'Result /= No_Element and then{"\n"}                not Has_Element (Container, Root'Result);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>110/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>Root returns a cursor that designates the root node of Container.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>110.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>There is always a root node, even in an empty container, so this function never returns No_Element. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>111/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Clear (Container : in out Tree){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Node_Count (Container) = 1;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>112/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>Removes all the elements from Container.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>112.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>The root node is not removed; all trees have a root node. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>113/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Element (Position : Cursor) return Element_Type{"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} (Position /= No_Element or else{"\n"}                  raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}               (Has_Element (Position) or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} Element_Type;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>114/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Element returns the element designated by Position.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>114.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>The root node does not contain an element, so that value cannot be read or written. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>114.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Element (Container : Tree;{"\n"}                  Position  : Cursor) return Element_Type{"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} (Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                  or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}               (Has_Element (Container, Position)  {"\n"}                  or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} Element_Type;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>114.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Element returns the element designated by Position in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>115/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Replace_Element (Container : in out Tree;{"\n"}                           Position  : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                           New_item  : in     Element_Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position) {"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>116/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0264-1", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0196-1"]} />
<p> Replace_Element assigns the value New_Item to the element designated by Position. For the purposes of determining whether the parameters overlap in a call to Replace_Element, the Container parameter is not considered to overlap with any object [(including itself)].<br /></p>

<MarginText>117/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Query_Element{"\n"}  (Position : in Cursor;{"\n"}   Process  : not null access procedure (Element : in Element_Type)){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Position) {"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}     Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>118/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Query_Element calls Process.<strong>all</strong> with the element designated by Position as the argument. Tampering with the elements of the tree that contains the element designated by Position is prohibited during the execution of the call on Process.<strong>all</strong>. Any exception raised by Process.<strong>all</strong> is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>118.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Query_Element{"\n"}  (Container : in Tree;{"\n"}   Position  : in Cursor;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Element : in Element_Type)){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position) {"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>118.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Query_Element calls Process.<strong>all</strong> with the element designated by Position as the argument. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited during the execution of the call on Process.<strong>all</strong>. Any exception raised by Process.<strong>all</strong> is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>119/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Update_Element{"\n"}  (Container : in out Tree;{"\n"}   Position  : in     Cursor;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure{"\n"}                   (Element : in out Element_Type)){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position) {"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>120/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0264-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Update_Element calls Process.<strong>all</strong> with the element designated by Position as the argument. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited during the execution of the call on Process.<strong>all</strong>. Any exception raised by Process.<strong>all</strong> is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>121/3</MarginText>
<p>If Element_Type is unconstrained and definite, then the actual Element parameter of Process.<strong>all</strong> shall be unconstrained.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>121.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>This means that the elements cannot be directly allocated from the heap; it must be possible to change the discriminants of the element in place. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>122/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
type Constant_Reference_Type{"\n"}      (Element : not null access constant Element_Type) is private{"\n"}   with Implicit_Dereference ={">"} Element,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in out synchronized,{"\n"}        Default_Initial_Condition ={">"} (raise Program_Error);{"\n"}
<MarginText>123/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
type Reference_Type (Element : not null access Element_Type) is private{"\n"}   with Implicit_Dereference ={">"} Element,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in out synchronized,{"\n"}        Default_Initial_Condition ={">"} (raise Program_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>124/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p>The types Constant_Reference_Type and Reference_Type need finalization.<br /></p>

<MarginText>125/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p><em>This paragraph was deleted.</em> <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>125.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>It is expected that Reference_Type (and Constant_Reference_Type) will be a controlled type, for which finalization will have some action to terminate the tampering check for the associated container. If the object is created by default, however, there is no associated container. Since this is useless, and supporting this case would take extra work, we define it to raise an exception. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>126/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Constant_Reference (Container : aliased in Tree;{"\n"}                             Position  : in Cursor){"\n"}   return Constant_Reference_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position) {"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post   ={">"} Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>127/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>This function (combined with the Constant_Indexing and Implicit_Dereference aspects) provides a convenient way to gain read access to an individual element of a tree given a cursor.<br /></p>

<MarginText>128/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Constant_Reference returns an object whose discriminant is an access value that designates the element designated by Position. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited while the object returned by Constant_Reference exists and has not been finalized.<br /></p>

<MarginText>129/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Reference (Container : aliased in out Tree;{"\n"}                    Position  : in Cursor){"\n"}   return Reference_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position) {"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post   ={">"} Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>130/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>This function (combined with the Variable_Indexing and Implicit_Dereference aspects) provides a convenient way to gain read and write access to an individual element of a tree given a cursor.<br /></p>

<MarginText>131/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Reference returns an object whose discriminant is an access value that designates the element designated by Position. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited while the object returned by Reference exists and has not been finalized.<br /></p>

<MarginText>132/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Assign (Target : in out Tree; Source : in Tree){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Node_Count (Source) = Node_Count (Target);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>133/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p>If Target denotes the same object as Source, the operation has no effect. Otherwise, the elements of Source are copied to Target as for an <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code> assigning Source to Target.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>133.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>Each element in Target has a parent element that corresponds to the parent element of the Source element, and has child elements that correspond to the child elements of the Source element. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>133.b/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0005-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>This routine exists for compatibility with the bounded tree container. For an unbounded tree, Assign(A, B) and A := B behave identically. For a bounded tree, := will raise an exception if the container capacities are different, while Assign will not raise an exception if there is enough room in the target. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>134/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Copy (Source : Tree) return Tree{"\n"}   with Post ={">"}{"\n"}           Node_Count (Copy'Result) = Node_Count (Source) and then{"\n"}           not Tampering_With_Elements_Prohibited (Copy'Result) and then{"\n"}           not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Copy'Result);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>135/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>Returns a tree with the same structure as Source and whose elements are initialized from the corresponding elements of Source.<br /></p>

<MarginText>136/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Move (Target : in out Tree;{"\n"}                Source : in out Tree){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Source){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if not Target'Has_Same_Storage (Source) then{"\n"}               Node_Count (Target) = Node_Count (Source'Old) and then{"\n"}               Node_Count (Source) = 1);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>137/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p>If Target denotes the same object as Source, then the operation has no effect. Otherwise, Move first calls Clear (Target). Then, the nodes other than the root node in Source are moved to Target (in the same positions). After Move completes, Node_Count (Target) is the number of nodes originally in Source, and Node_Count (Source) is 1.<br /></p>

<MarginText>138/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Delete_Leaf (Container : in out Tree;{"\n"}                       Position  : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Is_Leaf (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"}{"\n"}           Node_Count (Container)'Old = Node_Count (Container) + 1 and then{"\n"}           Position = No_Element;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>139/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
