<p> Delete_Leaf removes (from Container) the element designated by Position, and  Position is set to No_Element.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>139.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>The check on Position checks that the cursor does not belong to some other Container. This check implies that a reference to the container is included in the cursor value. This wording is not meant to require detection of dangling cursors; such cursors are defined to be invalid, which means that execution is erroneous, and any result is allowed (including not raising an exception).<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>139.b/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The root node cannot be deleted. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>140/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Delete_Subtree (Container : in out Tree;{"\n"}                          Position  : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Node_Count (Container)'Old = Node_Count (Container) +{"\n"}                   Subtree_Node_Count (Container, Position)'Old and then{"\n"}                Position = No_Element;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>141/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0264-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Delete_Subtree removes (from Container) the subtree designated by Position (that is, all descendants of the node designated by Position including the node itself), and Position is set to No_Element.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>141.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>The root node cannot be deleted. To delete the entire contents of the tree, call Clear(Container). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>142/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Swap (Container : in out Tree;{"\n"}                I, J      : in     Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (I /= No_Element or else Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (J /= No_Element or else Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, I){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, J){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>143/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Swap exchanges the values of the elements designated by I and J.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>143.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>After a call to Swap, I designates the element value previously designated by J, and J designates the element value previously designated by I. The position of the elements do not change; for instance, the parent node and the first child node of I are unchanged by the operation.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>143.b/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The root nodes do not contain element values, so they cannot be swapped. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>143.c/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<strong>To be honest: </strong>The implementation is not required to actually copy the elements if it can do the swap some other way. But it is allowed to copy the elements if needed. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>144/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Find (Container : Tree;{"\n"}               Item      : Element_Type){"\n"}   return Cursor{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} (if Find'Result /= No_Element{"\n"}                 then Has_Element (Container, Find'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>145/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>Find searches the elements of Container for an element equal to Item (using the generic formal equality operator). The search starts at the root node. The search traverses the tree in a depth-first order. If no equal element is found, then Find returns No_Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor designating the first equal element encountered.<br /></p>

<MarginText>146/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Find_In_Subtree (Position : Cursor;{"\n"}                          Item     : Element_Type){"\n"}   return Cursor{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Position /= No_Element or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Find_In_Subtree'Result = No_Element{"\n"}                 then Has_Element (Find_In_Subtree'Result)),{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>147/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Find_In_Subtree searches the subtree rooted by Position for an element equal to Item (using the generic formal equality operator). The search starts at the element designated by Position. The search traverses the subtree in a depth-first order. If no equal element is found, then Find returns No_Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor designating the first equal element encountered.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>147.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>Find_In_Subtree does not check any siblings of the element designated by Position. The root node does not contain an element, and therefore it can never be returned, but it can be explicitly passed to Position. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>147.1/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Find_In_Subtree (Container : Tree;{"\n"}                          Position  : Cursor;{"\n"}                          Item      : Element_Type){"\n"}   return Cursor{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Find_In_Subtree'Result = No_Element{"\n"}                 then Has_Element (Container, Find_In_Subtree'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>147.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Find_In_Subtree searches the subtree of Container rooted by Position for an element equal to Item (using the generic formal equality operator). The search starts at the element designated by Position. The search traverses the subtree in a depth-first order. If no equal element is found, then Find returns No_Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor designating the first equal element encountered.<br /></p>

<MarginText>148/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Ancestor_Find (Position : Cursor;{"\n"}                        Item     : Element_Type){"\n"}   return Cursor{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Position /= No_Element or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Ancestor_Find'Result = No_Element{"\n"}                 then Has_Element (Container, Ancestor_Find'Result)),{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>149/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Ancestor_Find searches for an element equal to Item (using the generic formal equality operator). The search starts at the node designated by Position, and checks each ancestor proceeding toward the root of the subtree. If no equal element is found, then Ancestor_Find returns No_Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor designating the first equal element encountered. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>149.a/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0248-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>No_Element is returned if Position is the root node. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>149.1/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Ancestor_Find (Container : Tree;{"\n"}                        Position  : Cursor;{"\n"}                        Item      : Element_Type){"\n"}   return Cursor{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Ancestor_Find'Result = No_Element{"\n"}                 then Has_Element (Container, Ancestor_Find'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>149.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Ancestor_Find searches for an element equal to Item (using the generic formal equality operator). The search starts at the node designated by Position in Container, and checks each ancestor proceeding toward the root of the subtree. If no equal element is found, then Ancestor_Find returns No_Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor designating the first equal element encountered.<br /></p>

<MarginText>150/3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Contains (Container : Tree;{"\n"}                   Item      : Element_Type) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>151/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Find (Container, Item) /= No_Element.<br /></p>

<MarginText>152/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Iterate{"\n"}  (Container : in Tree;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Position : in Cursor)){"\n"}   with Allows_Exit;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>153/4</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0069-1"]} />
<p>Iterate calls Process.<strong>all</strong> with a cursor that designates each element in Container, starting from the root node and proceeding in a depth-first order. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited during the execution of a call on Process.<strong>all</strong>. Any exception raised by Process.<strong>all</strong> is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>153.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>Process is not called with the root node, which does not have an associated element. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>153.b/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<strong></strong>The purpose of the tamper with cursors check is to prevent erroneous execution from the Position parameter of Process.<strong>all</strong> becoming invalid. This check takes place when the operations that tamper with the cursors of the container are called. The check cannot be made later (say in the body of Iterate), because that could cause the Position cursor to be invalid and potentially cause execution to become erroneous &mdash; defeating the purpose of the check.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>153.c/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
See Iterate for vectors (<a href="../AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a>) for a suggested implementation of the check. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>154/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Iterate_Subtree{"\n"}  (Position  : in Cursor;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Position : in Cursor)){"\n"}   with Allows_Exit,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position /= No_Element or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>155/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0069-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Iterate_Subtree calls Process.<strong>all</strong> with a cursor that designates each element in the subtree rooted by the node designated by Position, starting from the node designated by Position and proceeding in a depth-first order. Tampering with the cursors of the tree that contains the element designated by Position is prohibited during the execution of a call on Process.<strong>all</strong>. Any exception raised by Process.<strong>all</strong> is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>155.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>Position can be passed a cursor designating the root node; in that case, Process is not called with the root node, which does not have an associated element. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>155.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Iterate_Subtree{"\n"}  (Container : in Tree;{"\n"}   Position  : in Cursor;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Position : in Cursor)){"\n"}   with Allows_Exit,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>155.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Iterate_Subtree calls Process.<strong>all</strong> with a cursor that designates each element in the subtree rooted by the node designated by Position in Container, starting from the node designated by Position and proceeding in a depth-first order. Tampering with the cursors of the tree that contains the element designated by Position is prohibited during the execution of a call on Process.<strong>all</strong>. Any exception raised by Process.<strong>all</strong> is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>156/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Iterate (Container : in Tree){"\n"}   return Tree_Iterator_Interfaces.Parallel_Iterator 'Class{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>157/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0069-1", "AI12-0266-1"]} />
<p>Iterate returns an iterator object (see <a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.1">5.5.1</a>) that will generate a value for a loop parameter (see <a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.2">5.5.2</a>) designating each element in Container, starting from the root node and proceeding in a depth-first order when used as a forward iterator, and processing all nodes concurrently when used as a parallel iterator. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited while the iterator object exists (in particular, in the <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.1#S0166">sequence_of_statements</a></code> of the <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#S0178">loop_statement</a></code> whose <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#S0183">iterator_specification</a></code> denotes this object). The iterator object needs finalization.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>157.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>Exits are allowed from the loops created using the iterator objects. In particular, to stop the iteration at a particular cursor, just add <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>157.b/3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
exit when Cur = Stop;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>157.c/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
in the body of the loop (assuming that Cur is the loop parameter and Stop is the cursor that you want to stop at). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>158/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Iterate_Subtree (Position : in Cursor){"\n"}   return Tree_Iterator_Interfaces.Parallel_Iterator 'Class{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} Position /= No_Element or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>159/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0069-1", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0266-1"]} />
<p> Iterate_Subtree returns an iterator object (see <a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.1">5.5.1</a>) that will generate a value for a loop parameter (see <a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.2">5.5.2</a>) designating each element in the subtree rooted by the node designated by Position, starting from the node designated by Position and proceeding in a depth-first order when used as a forward iterator, and processing all nodes in the subtree concurrently when used as a parallel iterator.  Tampering with the cursors of the container that contains the node designated by Position is prohibited while the iterator object exists (in particular, in the <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.1#S0166">sequence_of_statements</a></code> of the <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#S0178">loop_statement</a></code> whose <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#S0183">iterator_specification</a></code> denotes this object). The iterator object needs finalization.<br /></p>

<MarginText>159.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Iterate_Subtree (Container : in Tree; Position : in Cursor){"\n"}   return Tree_Iterator_Interfaces.Parallel_Iterator'Class{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No_Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>159.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Iterate_Subtree returns an iterator object (see <a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.1">5.5.1</a>) that will generate a value for a loop parameter (see <a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.2">5.5.2</a>) designating each element in the subtree rooted by the node designated by Position in Container, starting from the node designated by Position and proceeding in a depth-first order when used as a forward iterator, and processing all nodes in the subtree concurrently when used as a parallel iterator. Tampering with the cursors of the container that contains the node designated by Position is prohibited while the iterator object exists (in particular, in the <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.1#S0166">sequence_of_statements</a></code> of the <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#S0178">loop_statement</a></code> whose <code><a href="../AA-5/AA-5.5#S0183">iterator_specification</a></code> denotes this object). The iterator object needs finalization.<br /></p>

<MarginText>160/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Child_Count (Parent : Cursor) return Count_Type{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} (if Parent = No_Element then Child_Count'Result = 0),{"\n"}         Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>161/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>Child_Count returns the number of child nodes of the node designated by Parent.<br /></p>

<MarginText>161.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Child_Count (Container : Tree; Parent : Cursor){"\n"}   return Count_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Meaningful_For (Container, Parent) {"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Parent = No_Element then Child_Count'Result = 0),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>161.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Child_Count returns the number of child nodes of the node designated by Parent in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>162/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Child_Depth (Parent, Child : Cursor) return Count_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Parent /= No_Element and then Child /= No_Element){"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error,{"\n"}     Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>163/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Child_Depth returns the number of ancestor nodes of Child (including Child itself), up to but not including Parent; Program_Error is propagated if Parent is not an ancestor of Child.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>163.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>Program_Error is propagated if Parent and Child are nodes in different containers.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>163.b/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Child_Depth (Root (Some_Tree), Child) + 1 = Depth (Child) as the root is not counted. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>163.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Child_Depth (Container : Tree; Parent, Child : Cursor){"\n"}   return Count_Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} ((Parent /= No_Element and then Child /= No_Element){"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Container, Parent){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Container, Child){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}           Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use_Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>163.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>Child_Depth returns the number of ancestor nodes of Child within Container (including Child itself), up to but not including Parent; Program_Error is propagated if Parent is not an ancestor of Child.<br /></p>

<MarginText>164/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert_Child (Container : in out Tree;{"\n"}                        Parent    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                        Before    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                        New_Item  : in     Element_Type;{"\n"}                        Count     : in     Count_Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Parent /= No_Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Container, Parent){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Container, Before){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No_Element or else{"\n"}                 Container.Parent (Before) = Parent{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Node_Count (Container) ={"\n"}                Node_Count (Container)'Old + Count;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>165/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Insert_Child allocates Count nodes containing copies of New_Item and inserts them as children of Parent. If Parent already has child nodes, then the new nodes are inserted prior to the node designated by Before, or, if Before equals No_Element, the new nodes are inserted after the last existing child node of Parent. Any exception raised during allocation of internal storage is propagated, and Container is not modified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>166/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert_Child (Container : in out Tree;{"\n"}                        Parent    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                        Before    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                        New_Item  : in     Element_Type;{"\n"}                        Position  :    out Cursor;{"\n"}                        Count     : in     Count_Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Parent /= No_Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Container, Parent){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Container, Before){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No_Element or else{"\n"}                 Container.Parent (Before) = Parent{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (Node_Count (Container) ={"\n"}                 Node_Count (Container)'Old + Count) and then{"\n"}                 Has_Element (Container, Position);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>167/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0257-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Insert_Child allocates Count nodes containing copies of New_Item and inserts them as children of Parent. If Parent already has child nodes, then the new nodes are inserted prior to the node designated by Before, or, if Before equals No_Element, the new nodes are inserted after the last existing child node of Parent. Position designates the first newly-inserted node, or if Count equals 0, then Position is assigned the value of Before. Any exception raised during allocation of internal storage is propagated, and Container is not modified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>168/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert_Child (Container : in out Tree;{"\n"}                        Parent    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                        Before    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                        Position  :    out Cursor;{"\n"}                        Count     : in     Count_Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Parent /= No_Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Container, Parent){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Container, Before){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No_Element or else{"\n"}                 Container.Parent (Before) = Parent{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (Node_Count (Container) ={"\n"}                 Node_Count (Container)'Old + Count) and then{"\n"}                 Has_Element (Container, Position);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>169/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0257-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI05-0264-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Insert_Child allocates Count nodes, the elements contained in the new nodes are initialized by default (see <a href="../AA-3/AA-3.3#Subclause_3.3.1">3.3.1</a>), and the new nodes are inserted as children of Parent. If Parent already has child nodes, then the new nodes are inserted prior to the node designated by Before, or, if Before equals No_Element, the new nodes are inserted after the last existing child node of Parent. Position designates the first newly-inserted node, or if Count equals 0, then Position is assigned the value of Before. Any exception raised during allocation of internal storage is propagated, and Container is not modified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>170/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Prepend_Child (Container : in out Tree;{"\n"}                         Parent    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                         New_Item  : in     Element_Type;{"\n"}                         Count     : in     Count_Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Parent /= No_Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Container, Parent){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Node_Count (Container) ={"\n"}                Node_Count (Container)'Old + Count;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>171/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Insert_Child (Container, Parent, First_Child (Container, Parent), New_Item, Count).<br /></p>

<MarginText>172/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Append_Child (Container : in out Tree;{"\n"}                        Parent    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                        New_Item  : in     Element_Type;{"\n"}                        Count     : in     Count_Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Parent /= No_Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Container, Parent){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Node_Count (Container) ={"\n"}                Node_Count (Container)'Old + Count;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>173/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>Equivalent to Insert_Child (Container, Parent, No_Element, New_Item, Count).<br /></p>

<MarginText>174/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Delete_Children (Container : in out Tree;{"\n"}                           Parent    : in     Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Parent /= No_Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Container, Parent){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (Node_Count (Container) = Node_Count (Container)'Old -{"\n"}                   Child_Count (Container, Parent)'Old) and then{"\n"}                 Child_Count (Container, Parent) = 0;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>175/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> Delete_Children removes (from Container) all of the descendants of Parent other than Parent itself.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>175.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>This routine deletes all of the child subtrees of Parent at once. Use Delete_Subtree to delete an individual subtree. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>176/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Copy_Subtree (Target   : in out Tree;{"\n"}                        Parent   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                        Before   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                        Source   : in     Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Parent /= No_Element{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Meaningful_For (Target, Parent){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Meaningful_For (Target, Before){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Before = No_Element or else{"\n"}                    Target.Parent (Before) = Parent{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                 (not Is_Root (Source){"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Node_Count (Target) ={"\n"}                Node_Count (Target)'Old + Subtree_Node_Count (Source),{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>177/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> If Source is equal to No_Element, then the operation has no effect. Otherwise, the subtree rooted by Source (which can be from any tree; it does not have to be a subtree of Target) is copied (new nodes are allocated to create a new subtree with the same structure as the Source subtree, with each element initialized from the corresponding element of the Source subtree) and inserted into Target as a child of Parent. If Parent already has child nodes, then the new nodes are inserted prior to the node designated by Before, or, if Before equals No_Element, the new nodes are inserted after the last existing child node of Parent. The parent of the newly created subtree is set to Parent, and the overall count of Target is incremented by Subtree_Node_Count (Source). Any exception raised during allocation of internal storage is propagated, and Container is not modified.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>177.a/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<strong></strong>We only need one routine here, as the source object is not modified, so we can use the same routine for both copying within and between containers. However, that requires a contract that allows reading of any container of the correct type, so we provide two other routines wuth more restrictive contracts. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>177.b/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>We do not allow copying a subtree that includes a root node, as that would require inserting a node with no value in the middle of the target tree. To copy an entire tree to another tree object, use Copy. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>177.1/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Copy_Local_Subtree (Target   : in out Tree;{"\n"}                              Parent   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                              Before   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                              Source   : in     Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Parent /= No_Element{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Meaningful_For (Target, Parent){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Meaningful_For (Target, Before){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Before = No_Element or else{"\n"}                    Target.Parent (Before) = Parent{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Meaningful_For (Target, Source){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                 (not Is_Root (Source){"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Node_Count (Target) = Node_Count (Target)'Old +{"\n"}                   Subtree_Node_Count (Target, Source);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>177.2/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>If Source is equal to No_Element, then the operation has no effect. Otherwise, the subtree rooted by Source in Target is copied (new nodes are allocated to create a new subtree with the same structure as the Source subtree, with each element initialized from the corresponding element of the Source subtree) and inserted into Target as a child of Parent. If Parent already has child nodes, then the new nodes are inserted prior to the node designated by Before, or, if Before equals No_Element, the new nodes are inserted after the last existing child node of Parent. The parent of the newly created subtree is set to Parent. Any exception raised during allocation of internal storage is propagated, and Container is not modified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>177.3/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Copy_Subtree (Target   : in out Tree;{"\n"}                        Parent   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                        Before   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                        Source   : in     Tree;{"\n"}                        Subtree  : in     Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Parent /= No_Element{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Meaningful_For (Target, Parent){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Meaningful_For (Target, Before){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Before = No_Element or else{"\n"}                    Target.Parent (Before) = Parent{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Meaningful_For (Source, Subtree){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                 (not Is_Root (Source, Subtree){"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Node_Count (Target) = Node_Count (Target)'Old +{"\n"}                   Subtree_Node_Count (Source, Subtree);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>177.4/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>If Subtree is equal to No_Element, then the operation has no effect. Otherwise, the subtree rooted by Subtree in Source is copied (new nodes are allocated to create a new subtree with the same structure as the Subtree, with each element initialized from the corresponding element of the Subtree) and inserted into Target as a child of Parent. If Parent already has child nodes, then the new nodes are inserted prior to the node designated by Before, or, if Before equals No_Element, the new nodes are inserted after the last existing child node of Parent. The parent of the newly created subtree is set to Parent. Any exception raised during allocation of internal storage is propagated, and Container is not modified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>178/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Splice_Subtree (Target   : in out Tree;{"\n"}                          Parent   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                          Before   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                          Source   : in out Tree;{"\n"}                          Position : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Source){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Parent /= No_Element{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Target, Parent){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Target, Before){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No_Element or else{"\n"}                 Target.Parent (Before) /= Parent{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Source, Position){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Target'Has_Same_Storage (Source) or else{"\n"}                 Position = Before or else{"\n"}                 Is_Ancestor_Of (Target, Position, Parent){"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (declare{"\n"}                    Org_Sub_Count renames{"\n"}                        Subtree_Node_Count (Source, Position)'Old;{"\n"}                    Org_Target_Count renames Node_Count (Target)'Old;{"\n"}                 begin{"\n"}                   (if not Target'Has_Same_Storage (Source) then{"\n"}                       Node_Count (Target) = Org_Target_Count +{"\n"}                          Org_Sub_Count and then{"\n"}                       Node_Count (Source) = Node_Count (Source)'Old -{"\n"}                          Org_Sub_Count and then{"\n"}                       Has_Element (Target, Position){"\n"}                    else{"\n"}                       Target.Parent (Position) = Parent and then{"\n"}                       Node_Count (Target) = Org_Target_Count));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>179/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> If Source denotes the same object as Target, then: if Position equals Before there is no effect;  otherwise, the subtree rooted by the element designated by Position is moved to be a child of Parent. If Parent already has child nodes, then the moved nodes are inserted prior to the node designated by Before, or, if Before equals No_Element, the moved nodes are inserted after the last existing child node of Parent. In each of these cases, Position and the count of Target are unchanged, and the parent of the element designated by Position is set to Parent.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>179.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>We can't allow moving the subtree of Position to a proper descendant node of the subtree, as the descendant node will be part of the subtree being moved. The result would be a circularly linked tree, or one with inaccessible nodes. Thus we have to check Position against Parent, even though such a check is <em>O</em>(Depth(Source)). <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>180/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p>Otherwise (if Source does not denote the same object as Target), the subtree designated by Position is removed from Source and moved to Target. The subtree is inserted as a child of Parent. If Parent already has child nodes, then the moved nodes are inserted prior to the node designated by Before, or, if Before equals No_Element, the moved nodes are inserted after the last existing child node of Parent. In each of these cases, the count of Target is incremented by Subtree_Node_Count (Position), and the count of Source is decremented by Subtree_Node_Count (Position), Position is updated to represent an element in Target.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>180.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>If Source is the same as Target, and Position = Before, or Next_Sibling(Position) = Before, Splice_Subtree has no effect, as the subtree does not have to move to meet the postcondition.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>180.b/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
We do not allow splicing a subtree that includes a root node, as that would require inserting a node with no value in the middle of the target tree. Splice the children of the root node instead.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>180.c/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
For this reason there is no operation to splice an entire tree, as that would necessarily involve splicing a root node. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>181/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Splice_Subtree (Container: in out Tree;{"\n"}                          Parent   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                          Before   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                          Position : in     Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Parent /= No_Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Container, Parent){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Container, Before){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No_Element or else{"\n"}                 Container.Parent (Before) /= Parent{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position /= No_Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has_Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position = Before or else{"\n"}                 Is_Ancestor_Of (Container, Position, Parent){"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (Node_Count (Container) ={"\n"}                   Node_Count (Container)'Old and then{"\n"}                 Container.Parent (Position) = Parent);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>182/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>  If Position equals Before, there is no effect.  Otherwise, the subtree rooted by the element designated by Position is moved to be a child of Parent. If Parent already has child nodes, then the moved nodes are inserted prior to the node designated by Before, or, if Before equals No_Element, the moved nodes are inserted after the last existing child node of Parent. The parent of the element designated by Position is set to Parent.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>182.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>We can't allow moving the subtree of Position to a proper descendant node of the subtree, as the descendant node will be part of the subtree being moved. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>183/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Splice_Children (Target          : in out Tree;{"\n"}                           Target_Parent   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                           Before          : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                           Source          : in out Tree;{"\n"}                           Source_Parent   : in     Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Source){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Target_Parent /= No_Element{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Target, Target_Parent){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Target, Before){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Source_Parent /= No_Element{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Source, Source_Parent){"\n"}                    or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No_Element or else{"\n"}                 Parent (Target, Before) /= Target_Parent{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Target'Has_Same_Storage (Source) or else{"\n"}                 Target_Parent = Source_Parent or else{"\n"}                 Is_Ancestor_Of (Target, Source_Parent, Target_Parent){"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (declare{"\n"}                    Org_Child_Count renames{"\n"}                       Child_Count (Source, Source_Parent)'Old;{"\n"}                    Org_Target_Count renames Node_Count (Target)'Old;{"\n"}                 begin{"\n"}                   (if not Target'Has_Same_Storage (Source) then{"\n"}                       Node_Count (Target) = Org_Target_Count +{"\n"}                          Org_Child_Count and then{"\n"}                       Node_Count (Source) = Node_Count (Source)'Old -{"\n"}                          Org_Child_Count{"\n"}                    else{"\n"}                       Node_Count (Target) = Org_Target_Count));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>184/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p><em>This paragraph was deleted.</em> <br /></p>

<MarginText>185/3</MarginText>
<p>If Source denotes the same object as Target, then:<br /></p>

<MarginText>186/3</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>if Target_Parent equals Source_Parent there is no effect; else<br /></li>
<MarginText>187/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<li><em>This paragraph was deleted.</em> <br /></li>
<MarginText>188/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<li>the child elements (and the further descendants) of Source_Parent are moved to be child elements of Target_Parent. If Target_Parent already has child elements, then the moved elements are inserted prior to the node designated by Before, or, if Before equals No_Element, the moved elements are inserted after the last existing child node of Target_Parent. The parent of each moved child element is set to Target_Parent. <br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>188.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<strong></strong>We can't allow moving the children of Source_Parent to a proper descendant node, as the descendant node will be part of one of the subtrees being moved. <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>189/3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>Otherwise (if Source does not denote the same object as Target), the child elements (and the further descendants) of Source_Parent are removed from Source and moved to Target. The child elements are inserted as children of Target_Parent. If Target_Parent already has child elements, then the moved elements are inserted prior to the node designated by Before, or, if Before equals No_Element, the moved elements are inserted after the last existing child node of Target_Parent. In each of these cases, the overall count of Target is incremented by Subtree_Node_Count (Source_Parent)-1, and the overall count of Source is decremented by Subtree_Node_Count (Source_Parent)-1.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>189.a/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<strong></strong>The node designated by Source_Parent is not moved, thus we never need to update Source_Parent.<br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>189.b/3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Move (Target, Source) could be written Splice_Children (Target, Target.Root, No_Element, Source, Source.Root); <br /></Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>190/5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Splice_Children (Container       : in out Tree;{"\n"}                           Target_Parent   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                           Before          : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                           Source_Parent   : in     Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering_With_Cursors_Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Target_Parent /= No_Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Container, Target_Parent){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Container, Before){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Source_Parent /= No_Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful_For (Container, Source_Parent){"\n"}                   or else raise Program_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No_Element or else{"\n"}                 Parent (Container, Before) /= Target_Parent{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error) and then{"\n"}                (Target_Parent = Source_Parent or else{"\n"}                 Is_Ancestor_Of (Container, Source_Parent, Target_Parent){"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint_Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Node_Count (Container) = Node_Count (Container)'Old;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>191/5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI05-0264-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p> If Target_Parent equals Source_Parent there is no effect.  Otherwise, the child elements (and the further descendants) of Source_Parent are moved to be child elements of Target_Parent. If Target_Parent already has child elements, then the moved elements are inserted prior to the node designated by Before, or, if Before equals No_Element, the moved elements are inserted after the last existing child node of Target_Parent. The parent of each moved child element is set to Target_Parent.<br /></p>

<MarginText>212/3</MarginText>
